{"id_":"uOTwyoSYyHJV0N8yRVZtAG/ZL7MwpLQtaDDTpxFiG20=","metadata":{},"excludedEmbedMetadataKeys":[],"excludedLlmMetadataKeys":[],"relationships":{},"hash":"Iz0OQd6qgEUswnfnmOiJxQaCqovoCYqQdTDJDr0+6AY=","text":"© 2023 Medaica Inc.                              info@medaica.com |  www.medaica.com  
DATA SHEET 
 Medaica Telehealth+ 
 Simple, affordable, telehealth solution that combines a                                       
FREE FDA-cleared stethoscope for remote auscultation.  
- Improve the efficiency of supporting remote patients  
with clinical-grade exams and better outcomes
 
Medaica Telehealth+ is a simple and effective way for 
providers to extend their remote health capabilities.  
More than basic telehealth video conferencing, 
Medaica Telehealth+ is a digital-first connected care 
platform that combines audio/video features with a 
FREE FDA-cleared OTC stethoscope, specifically 
designed for plug-and-play remote auscultation, so 
healthcare providers can listen to a remote patient as 
easily and clearly as if they were in the same room. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
MEDAICA TELEHEALTH+ FEATURES 
Patient App 
• iOS 15+, iPadOS 15+, Android 12+. 
HCP App  
• Windows 10 and up, MacOS 10 and up on any 
browser supporting Web RTC including Chrome. 
• Patented remote auscultation guide for simple 
patient navigation, (HCP moves a virtual target for 
patient to place device). 
• Patented live-stream with background near real-time 
lossless upload (ensures clinical-grade audio is not  
• impacted by inconsistent internet connection). 
• Virtual, Store and Forward and In-Person Exams. 
• PCG visualization, loop and zoom. 
• Save and share recordings for benchmarking, 
longitudinal and cohort comparisons. 
• HCP interface includes stethoscope volume, filters, 
auscultation position, notes, patient messaging,   
waiting room, patient present alert, export to EMR. 
• Fully encrypted end-to-end, HIPAA compliant. 
 
 
M1 Telehealth Stethoscope. 
• FDA cleared 510(k), Class II, OTC, intended to be used  
by professional users in a clinical environment or by    
lay users 18+ (and approved for over 65 yrs old) in a 
nonclinical environment.  
• Specifically designed for remote auscultation over 
telehealth. 
• Patented two microphone design for auto-switching 
between auscultation and speaking for simple multi-
modal patient/ provider communications and 
auscultation recording.  
• Patented remote guidance for device placement. 
• Noise reduction: ambient, room and frictional. 
• Frequency response 20 - 3,500 Hz. 
• USB-C with included USB-2 and Lightning adapters. 
• Dimensions 134.5 x 17.5 x 33.4 mm. 
• IP24. 
Use Cases  
Chronic patient follow-up, Assisted diagnostics, Reducing 
readmissions, Clinical education, In-field EMS triage and 
Clinical support, Digital at home screening, Rural 
healthcare support, Retail/urgent care support. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
  
HOW TO BUY 
Medaica Telehealth+ is bundled with the M1 stethoscope 
and licensed on a per-use.   
Contact: info@medaica.com 
®

I6NQZpxkCWWUzibxDsEJeLi1HfMYxkaNIgUGK7fN.__data__:
{"id_":"I6NQZpxkCWWUzibxDsEJeLi1HfMYxkaNIgUGK7fNMFE=","metadata":{},"excludedEmbedMetadataKeys":[],"excludedLlmMetadataKeys":[],"relationships":{},"hash":"QqDGIrT6pHdVBvwE69UXnUB9asj5qQdjQh86mNHzgS4=","text":"	
 
         March 2021
 
CONFIDENTIAL
 
1  
MEDAICA BUSINESS PLAN - EXECUTIVE SUMMARY 
INTRODUCTION 
MEDAICA is a digital health company dedicated to extending the capability of remote care across any telehealth system, 
simply and affordably.  
The Company’s Mission is “to enable digital health for everyone.” 
MEDAICA’s Vision is “a world where everyone has access to healthcare, anywhere.” 
The Company was founded by serial entrepreneurs with proven global experience in developing and scaling hardware and 
software  platforms,  managing  healthcare  businesses, and in bringing 
MedTech devices to market.  
MEDAICA’s first product the M1 Telehealth Stethoscope (“M1”) is a 
sub $50 plug-and-play  digital  stethoscope and  software  system 
specifically designed for interoperability  with any  telehealth 
application  to  enable  healthcare  professionals  to  remotely diagnose 
heart and body sounds. The patented M1 features ambient noise reduction, 
body and speaker independent microphones and can either be used by a patient in 
a live telehealth  session, or in “Store and Forward” mode, where a doctor can listen to the 
patient’s auscultation sounds in their own time, store them in the patient’s medical record and/or use them for 
baselining and future comparison. M1 improves quality of care, is convenient for the patient, increases revenue to the 
provider and reduces costs to the payer.    
OPPORTUNITY & TAM 
Although telemedicine is becoming increasingly popular (80% of people in USA have had a telehealth experience in the last 12 
months. Source McKinsey 2021), it is mostly limited to a few practice areas. J.P. Morgan estimates at least 35% of health visits 
will move to a “digital first” experience. Auscultation (listening to heart, lungs and other body sounds) is an integral part of a 
doctor’s clinical exam, yet there is no affordable or simple device that enables telehealth auscultation resulting in incomplete, 
or inefficient telehealth exams and reduced reimbursement fees.  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Companies such as 3M, Eko Health and Tytocare, offer electronic stethoscopes priced from $138 - $500, however, other than 
TytoHome, ($249 + subscription), no devices have been cleared by the FDA for home use and none of the companies are 
“consumerising” the experience; instead, they provide complex products, not optimized for telehealth applications, and 
requiring expensive subscriptions to proprietary software to be used remotely. According to Deloitte Insights, The Future of 
Virtual Health, April 2020, by 2030, data, interoperability and consumer health technologies will be table stakes. 
MEDAICA addresses the market opportunity and shortcomings in existing devices by being focused on:  
• Affordable – Priced for consumer scale. 
• Accessible – By building interoperability into the platform from the start, MEDAICA does not compete with telemedicine 
platforms. We provide plug & play solutions to any telemedicine platform as well as adding value by extending their 
platforms to new specialties, generating incremental revenues and/or increasing subscribers and stickiness. 
• Simple  – Ease of use for patients with minimal behavioral change and little or no workflow changes for professionals. 
","textTemplate":"","metadataSeparator":"
","type":"DOCUMENT"}

         March 2021
 
CONFIDENTIAL
 
2  
The MEDAICA M1 Telehealth Stethoscope is a Trojan Horse to generate “Ground Truth” data that in turn will sustain the 
Company’s software business and ecosystem for 3
rd
 party services. Additionally, once the user-base and value of data is 
established, MEDAICA can white label and/or OEM its platform to other companies and establish a de-facto standard for 
enhanced remote care services. The Company will be able to sell premium services and leverage insights from its data that will 
become increasingly valuable for insurers/payers, healthcare practitioners and medical research. To that end, ultimately, data 
is MEDAICA’s most valuable IP asset (monetizable via additional diagnostic ML/AI services, API access, aggregated, geographic, 
historic data etc.), attracting annuity revenues via insights into the vital signs of millions of people and numerous touchpoints 
to upsell new products and/or services. Business models include but are not limited to, charging patients and/or telemedicine 
companies for  premium diagnostic  features,  surfacing  trends  (locally/nationally/globally),  working  with  payers  to ensure 
patients are adhering to their monitoring plans, and/or reducing re-admission rates. 
BUSINESS MODEL & FORECAST 
MEDAICA’s path to the consumer is a three-phase strategy:  
PHASE I: ADOPTION - M1 will initially be sold B2B2C, via telemedicine platform providers and large hospital groups, focusing 
on smaller and medium sized opportunities and strategic partners to build out end-to-end infrastructure and gain exposure in 
the marketplace.  
PHASE II: SCALE - With B2B2C market penetration, MEDAICA will start selling to retail (via distributors and direct web) and 
expanding overseas, first E.U. + U.K. 
PHASE III: DATA - With consumer scale comes the ability to standardize data and open the MEDAICA platform to 3
rd
 party 
developers  (such  as  AI  providers  and  other  hardware  companies). This  will  enable more vertical services such as ML/AI 
diagnostic applications that can further enhance the value to consumers and healthcare providers and establish MEDAICA’s 
data and platform as dominant solutions for heart and lung health.   
 MEDAICA’s unit sales are forecast conservatively at 6,750 in the first 6 months as the business builds support, customer success 
processes and infrastructure. As the business scales, new unit U.S. sales are forecast to grow from 252,750 in 2022 to 1.13 
million in 2024, translating into a userbase approaching 2 million users by the end of 2024. This growth will be achieved by; 1) 
Focusing on medium and large B2B customers, having proven the model with smaller customers in the first 12 months; 2) 
Leveraging the growing user base of telemedicine 
platforms  where  the  “pain”  to  provide  stickier 
services and greater utility is anticipated to create 
strategic opportunities; 3)  Selling to retail 
distributors and/or direct to consumers starting 
in 2023. 
The  unit  selling  price  to  B2B  partners  ranges 
between   $49-$79   depending   on   volume 
commitments. The  business  is  also  likely  to 
generate  Non-Recurring  Engineering  (NRE)  fees 
for  specific  customization  or  integration  work 
that  could  be  required  for  early  installations.  
Such revenue is NOT a long-term business model, 
but it is useful in subsidizing development  and 
roadmap costs.

RJmPJ041hLuYugu8UCknsh9kBj3TZ06muwK4qeNM.__data__:
{"id_":"RJmPJ041hLuYugu8UCknsh9kBj3TZ06muwK4qeNMYkA=","metadata":{},"excludedEmbedMetadataKeys":[],"excludedLlmMetadataKeys":[],"relationships":{},"hash":"GbdnakoKYvass5dSCRzfUTrpDbf6nHzxlj4xBNV8uWo=","text":"
	
 
         March 2021
 
CONFIDENTIAL
 
3  
During the second year of sales, as the userbase exceeds 250k users, the business model starts to generate annuity revenues 
and/or licensee fees (charged on a $1-$5 per-click or per seat fee, charged to telemedicine companies). The business becomes 
EBIT positive in 2023 and grows from EBIT of $4M that year (on revenue of $34M) to EBIT of $26M in 2024 (on revenue of 
$76M) as economies of scale, recurring sales and market validation benefits take effect.  
EveryBeatEveryBreath.org 
MEDAICA is working on a cause-driven campaign under the banner of EveryBeatEveryBreath.org, to provide devices at low or 
no cost to remote, underserved communities and disadvantaged groups. In the USA, nearly 53 million people (16%) live more 
than 30 miles from a hospital or urgent care. Globally, an estimated one billion people have no access to essential health-care 
services. The campaign aims to raise awareness of this issue and underpins MEDAICA’s mission.  
TEAM 
MEDAICA’s founding team has a rare mix of proven MedTech, healthcare, hardware, software and finance experience, both in 
global B2B and B2C businesses. 
 
STEPHEN RANDALL, CEO:  
A  serial  entrepreneur  with global  experience  building 
technology       platform businesses,  Stephen  was 
COO   of   M3dicine, a MedTech  device  company, 
CEO  of  LocaModa  Inc.,  a Digital   Out   of   Home 
platform         company (acquired    by    Monster 
Media) a founder, COO and EVP of Symbian, the mobile 
OS company and Joint CEO of  Psion  Software  PLC.,  a  
mobile         computing company. 
MARK GRETTON, CTO:  
Mark  has  over  thirty  years of technology management 
including           senior  management/CTO  roles  at 
Psion   PLC   where   he developed  one  of  the  first 
ARM   based   application specific processor chips and 
TomTom  N.V.  where  he built  the  engineering  team 
that     developed     the company’s ground-breaking 
range  of  navigation  and Health-tech  devices  with 
over a 100m units sold.  
CLIVE MILLINGTON, COO:  
Consumer  and  Technology Products  expert  who  has 
deployed      >100million connected  devices  globally 
(Satnav,  Health-tech  and Sports  wearables).  Former 
CEO  of  AYR  and  COO  of TomTom N.V. with over 35 
years’ experience  in early-stage companies through to 
IPO  and  onto  consumer brands     with     global 
recognition. Builder of high-performance    companies, 
products and teams. 
PABLO RIVAS, CFO/CRO:  
Before MEDAICA,  Pablo  was CFO  at  M3dicine, a  MedTech 
company and  CEO  of  the largest   American   chain   of 
Hospitals  in  Mexico.  With  15 years’ experience  in  M&A  at 
European and American banks, he   led   multiple   deals   in 
Healthcare, Biotech,  Health Insurance  and  Pharma. Pablo 
holds a Wharton MBA, MA in International   Studies   from 
Univ. of Penn- Lauder Institute and post grad. degree in Mgmt. 
from Harvard University. Angel investor in over 10 companies. 
DAN GIESCHEN, CPO:  
Founder   and   Head   of Product  at  Double  Down 
Interactive   (acquired   by IGT).          Experienced 
developing,  launching  and scaling    technology    for 
companies including the US Dept  of  Education,  Citgo, 
Canon,  Konica  Minolta  and Kimberley  Clark.  Head  of 
Technology for Drop in  the Bucket, a non-profit building 
wells    and    sanitations systems at schools in Africa. 
Board  member  at  IndieFlix Group Inc. Angel Investor. 
NICK  GIESCHEN,  HEAD of SOFTWARE:  
Founder  and  Head  of Software   at   Double 
Down       Interactive (acquired by IGT) where 
he     led     platform development      from 
concept,  launch,  scale and exit. Prior to Double 
Down,    20+    years developing     software 
platforms  for  startups and    Fortune    500 
companies.       Angel investor. 
ADVISORS:  
DR. ALISA NIKSCH, MD – Telehealth and Clinical Advisor: Assistant Professor of Pediatrics and  Pediatric  Cardiology,  Tufts  University  School  of  Medicine,  Chief  Medical  Officer, 
Genetesis,  Inc.,  Team  Lead-Supply  Chain  and  Strategic  partnerships,  GetUsPPE,  Clinical Advisory Board Member- AliveCor, Inc., Scientific Advisor- Genetesis, Inc., Fellow, Doximity, 
Inc., Chair, Women in Digital Health Initiative, MassChallenge. 
DR. JENNIFER JOE, MD – Telehealth and Clinical Advisor: ER Physician,  Digital Health & Telemedicine  KoL.  Founder  and  Editor-in-Chief  of  MedTech  Boston, American  Medical 
Women's Association, Member, Health and Public Policy Committee, American College of Physicians,  MIT  Media  Lab,  Senior  Medical  Science  Liaison,  Barkey  GmbH,  Principal, 
Vanguard Health. 
DR. REGINA S. DRUZ, MD, FACC, FASNC – Telehealth and Clinical Advisor: Member of the American Society of Nuclear Cardiology (ASNC) Board of Directors, chairwomen of the American 
College  of  Cardiology  (ACC)  Healthcare  Innovation  Section,  and  Cardiologist  at  Integrative Cardiology Center of Long Island, N.Y. 
DR.  GLENN  TUCKER,  MD – Telehealth  and  Clinical  Advisor: Former  Chair,  Committee  on Information Technology, Massachusetts Medical Society. Board Certified in Internal Medicine 
and Clinical Informatics. Specialties: Medical practice, primary care, health care IT, electronic health records, HER. 
MICHAEL DRUES – Regulatory Advisor: President Vascular Sciences, Ex FDA, Adjunct Professor Cornell University, Dept Biomedical Engineering. IP 
The Company has 4 patent applications:  
1) Health hub using unique web-links to control access rights and enable additional services such as but not limited to 
diagnostic analysis, user verification, third party access rights, sharing/viewing rules and financial controls. 
2) Telehealth audio methods including separate auscultation and user/room microphones.  
3) High  level  healthcare  programming  environment enabling  device/exam  instructions,  reminders  and  message 
notifications to be  "chained"  together  to  help doctors  and  healthcare  organizations  produce  simple healthcare 
management protocols for remote patient care. 
4) Telehealth self-exam methods including tagging sounds to body map positions, doctor remote controls and patient self-
exam augmented reality positioning. 
MEDAICA will continue putting significant resources on IP and patents as we believe innovation is core to our Mission. 
Full patent details available on request.

S8v/c1lTKfY/sdwUrhOKIPUTG05Rl402KABm4FWO.__data__:
{"id_":"S8v/c1lTKfY/sdwUrhOKIPUTG05Rl402KABm4FWOjGY=","metadata":{},"excludedEmbedMetadataKeys":[],"excludedLlmMetadataKeys":[],"relationships":{},"hash":"eN6gO6Ae/yXjrY8xaVygmtvh3WJ8IghNeh+fPpCWN60=","text":"
Is this an overcrowded space?
No! There are companies with expensive and proprietary diagnostic tools for 
doctors or companies with limited telehealth 1.0 solutions. NO COMPANY has a 
platform with inexpensive FDA-cleared OTC sensors and interoperable software 
for patients to access value-based chronic cardiac and pulmonary diagnostics.
Could incumbants copy Medaica strategy?
Competiting devices are ~$300+ vs Medaica‘s free sensors and are all proprietary, 
and don‘t work with telehealth systems without custom integration. Device 
companies (as opposed to software platforms), depend on high hardware margins. 
Telehealth platforms do not include sensors. Changing strategy would be a radical 
culture, org, tech and margin dispruption.
Won‘t an army of cheaper sensor companies rush into the market?
Sensors will continue to get cheaper (Moore‘s Law), but are unlikley to have FDA 
clearance for OTC, or be interoperable with virtual health A/V.
Won’t Apple, Amazon or Google own this market? 
They are focused on broader healthcare strategies, which not interoperable (as 
can be seen via their respective approaches with medical records, research data, 
wearables and consumer apps). Amazon (via One Medical) is less device and 
service centric, so is a more interesting strategic player. If they are interested in 
what we’re doing, they’d be more likely to acquire us. 
Isn‘t virtual health growth slower in a post-COVID world?
Yes –but higher than pre-Covid and growing. The perfect storm of over-burdened 
clincs, aging populations, expensive healthcare (in USA), and consumer comfort of 
“Digital First“ will lead to remote care that replaces a majority of unnecessary  in-
person health visits. Furthrmore, Teleheath 2.0 will replace the limited Telehealth   
1.0 and result in higher utility and growth. 
Who owns the data?
Medaica owns the generic, aggregrated, non-identifiable data and has no desire to 
own personally identifiable information. Our licensees own PII.
What other products/services are planned?
Medaica‘s roadmap includes A.I., other sensors, and opening up the platform (OTIS) to 
3rd party devices, apps and services. 
What are Medaica‘s sustainable competitive advantages?
FDA clearance, Patents, Free/Scalable consumer device model (Razor/razorblade 
model), Data aggregation (first to get to 10s of millions of ausculation samples can 
dominate application and AI area), World class team.
Who‘s your customer?
Payors/ACOs, motivated to save on readmissions, or offer better outcomes. Ultimately, 
the consumer will pay for services either directly or via their insurance. 
What‘s a likely exit?
Companies like Amazon or Wallmart looking at healthcare as a new consumer market. 
Google looking at the data play. Amwell or Teladoc looking to increase value/reach and 
stickiness of services. Medtronic, Omron, Boston Scientific, etc. 
Aren‘t doctors threatened by A.I. and/or virtual care?
Market reserach confirms that most HCPs believe A.I. for assisted diganostics and 
virtial care are essential as part of the solution to improving outcomes and efficiences.
How is the data going to be monetized?
Exams are monetized. Additionally we will charge for longitudinal data, A.I. analyzed 
data, condition-based applications/services, research applications and ecosystem tariffs 
for 3rd Parties.
Is Medaica a hardware or software business?
Medaica is a software platform business. Specifcally, our platform is the enabling 
middleware glue, connecting endpoints between patients and providers. The M1 sensor 
is a Trojan Horse that, by giving away, seeds our scale.
What keeps you up at night?
Everything! Execution of new models in a traditional market is always challenging. But 
that‘s also the opportunity.
Elephant(s) in the Room (The most asked questions)
","textTemplate":"","metadataSeparator":"
","type":"DOCUMENT"}

LWWPGcKbp8rKh6ykdbiJ6kS7Wk6nUq2oGi3HGPkc.__data__:
{"id_":"LWWPGcKbp8rKh6ykdbiJ6kS7Wk6nUq2oGi3HGPkcEE4=","metadata":{},"excludedEmbedMetadataKeys":[],"excludedLlmMetadataKeys":[],"relationships":{},"hash":"smW88Bh/F0M0wRLDNj1MUDnMnCu5XjMKiBAS+lVY3hs=","text":" 
 
         April 2021 CONFIDENTIAL 1 
 
MEDAICA BUSINESS PLAN - EXECUTIVE SUMMARY 
INTRODUCTION 
MEDAICA is a digital health company dedicated to extending the capability of remote care across any telehealth system, 
simply and affordably.  
The Company’s Mission is “to enable digital health for everyone.” 
MEDAICA’s Vision is “a world where everyone has access to healthcare, anywhere.” 
The Company was founded by serial entrepreneurs with proven global experience in developing and scaling hardware and 
software   platforms,   managing   healthcare   businesses, and in bringing 
MedTech devices to market.  
MEDAICA’s first product the M1 Telehealth Stethoscope (“M1”) is a 
sub $50 plug-and-play  digital  stethoscope and  software  system 
specifically designed for interoperability   with any   telehealth 
application  to  enable  healthcare  professionals  to  remotely diagnose 
heart and body sounds. The patented M1 features ambient noise reduction, 
body and speaker independent microphones and can either be used by a patient in 
a live telehealth  session, or in “Store and Forward” mode, where a doctor  can  listen  to  the 
patient’s auscultation sounds in their own time, store them in the patient’s medical record and/or use them for 
baselining  and  future  comparison. M1 improves quality  of  care, is  convenient  for  the  patient,  increases  revenue  to  the 
provider and reduces costs to the payer.    
OPPORTUNITY & TAM 
Although telemedicine is becoming increasingly popular (80% of people in USA have had a telehealth experience in the last 12 
months, Source McKinsey 2021), it is mostly limited to a few practice areas. In 2019, pre-COVID-19, J.P. Morgan estimated at least 35% 
of health visits will move to a “digital first” experience. Auscultation (listening to heart, lungs and other body sounds) is an 
integral part of a doctor’s clinical exam, yet  there  is  no  affordable  or  simple  device  that  enables  telehealth  auscultation 
resulting in incomplete, or inefficient telehealth exams and reduced reimbursement fees.  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Companies such as 3M, Eko Health and Tytocare, offer electronic stethoscopes priced from $138 - $500, however, other than 
TytoHome,  ($249 +  subscription),  no  devices  have  been  cleared  by  the  FDA  for  home  use  and  none  of  the  companies  are 
“consumerising” the  experience;  instead,  they  provide  complex  products,  not  optimized  for  telehealth  applications,  and 
requiring expensive subscriptions to proprietary software to be used remotely. According to Deloitte Insights, The Future of 
Virtual Health, April 2020, by 2030, data, interoperability and consumer health technologies will be table stakes. 
MEDAICA addresses the market opportunity and shortcomings in existing devices by being focused on:  
• Affordable – Priced for consumer scale. 
• Accessible – By building interoperability into the platform from the start, MEDAICA does not compete with telemedicine 
platforms. We provide plug & play solutions to any telemedicine platform as well as adding value by extending their 
platforms to new specialties, generating incremental revenues and/or increasing subscribers and stickiness. 
• Simple  – Ease of use for patients with minimal behavioral change and little or no workflow changes for professionals. 
","textTemplate":"","metadataSeparator":"
","type":"DOCUMENT"}

pOTOxZfwA7x2TYhxsCwGUfv+aMgOEmol49ZwNAmd.__data__:
{"id_":"pOTOxZfwA7x2TYhxsCwGUfv+aMgOEmol49ZwNAmdM1s=","metadata":{},"excludedEmbedMetadataKeys":[],"excludedLlmMetadataKeys":[],"relationships":{},"hash":"nHHFbIN4bgK5Lvfn8t0Cn0W7zvIHRTFcrg3RR6lKJiI=","text":"
 
 
         April 2021 CONFIDENTIAL 2 
 
The MEDAICA M1 Telehealth Stethoscope is a Trojan Horse to generate “Ground Truth” data that in turn will sustain the 
Company’s software business and ecosystem for 3rd party  services.  Additionally,  once  the  user-base  and  value  of  data  is 
established, MEDAICA can  white  label  and/or  OEM  its  platform  to  other  companies  and  establish  a  de-facto  standard  for 
enhanced remote care services. The Company will be able to sell premium services and leverage insights from its data that will 
become increasingly valuable for insurers/payers, healthcare practitioners and medical research. To that end, ultimately, data 
is MEDAICA’s most valuable IP asset (monetizable via additional diagnostic ML/AI services, API access, aggregated, geographic, 
historic data etc.), attracting annuity revenues via insights into the vital signs of millions of people and numerous touchpoints 
to upsell new products and/or services. Business models include but are not limited to, charging patients and/or telemedicine 
companies  for  premium  diagnostic  features,  surfacing  trends  (locally/nationally/globally),  working  with  payers  to  ensure 
patients are adhering to their monitoring plans, and/or reducing re-admission rates. 
BUSINESS MODEL & FORECAST 
MEDAICA’s path to the consumer is a three-phase strategy:  
PHASE I: ADOPTION - M1 will initially be sold B2B2C, via telemedicine platform providers and large hospital groups, focusing 
on smaller and medium sized opportunities and strategic partners to build out end-to-end infrastructure and gain exposure in 
the marketplace.  
PHASE II: SCALE - With B2B2C market penetration, MEDAICA will start selling to retail (via distributors and direct web) and 
expanding overseas, first E.U. + U.K. 
PHASE III: DATA - With consumer scale comes the ability to standardize data and open the MEDAICA platform to  3rd party 
developers  (such  as  AI  providers  and  other  hardware  companies).  This  will  enable more  vertical  services  such  as ML/AI 
diagnostic applications that can further enhance the value to consumers and healthcare providers and establish MEDAICA’s 
data and platform as dominant solutions for heart and lung health.   
 
MEDAICA’s unit sales are forecast conservatively at 6,750 in the first 6 months as the business builds support, customer success 
processes and infrastructure. As the business scales, new unit U.S. sales are forecast to grow from 252,750 in 2022 to 1.13 
million in 2024, translating into a userbase approaching 2 million users by the end of 2024. This growth will be achieved by; 1) 
Focusing on medium and  large B2B customers, having proven the model with smaller customers in  the first  12 months; 2) 
Leveraging    the    growing    user    base    of 
telemedicine platforms where the “pain” to 
provide stickier services and greater utility is 
anticipated to create strategic opportunities; 
3) Selling to retail distributors and/or direct to 
consumers starting in 2023. 
The unit selling price to B2B partners ranges 
between   $49-$79   depending   on   volume 
commitments. The  business  is  also  likely  to 
generate   Non-Recurring   Engineering   (NRE) 
fees for specific customization or integration 
work   that   could   be   required   for   early 
installations.    Such  revenue  is  NOT  a  long-
term   business   model,   but it is   useful   in 
subsidizing development and roadmap costs.

l4e98L5rfCT0pscj1KtlXs02aBQpKMtukjKLyppI.__data__:
{"id_":"l4e98L5rfCT0pscj1KtlXs02aBQpKMtukjKLyppItVE=","metadata":{},"excludedEmbedMetadataKeys":[],"excludedLlmMetadataKeys":[],"relationships":{},"hash":"jjTrnAS2Oq8mJGk8nbkK22vFJ/7pDxnfzLu9P71llo0=","text":"
 
 
         April 2021 CONFIDENTIAL 3 
 
During the second year of sales, as the userbase exceeds 250k users, the business model starts to generate annuity revenues 
and/or licensee fees (charged on a $1-$5 per-click or per seat fee, charged to telemedicine companies). The business becomes 
EBIT positive in 2023 and grows from EBIT of $4M that year (on revenue of $34M) to EBIT of $26M in 2024 (on revenue of 
$76M) as economies of scale, recurring sales and market validation benefits take effect.  
EveryBeatEveryBreath.org 
MEDAICA is working on a cause-driven campaign under the banner of EveryBeatEveryBreath.org, to provide devices at low or 
no cost to remote, underserved communities and disadvantaged groups. In the USA, nearly 53 million people (16%) live more 
than 30 miles from a hospital or urgent care. Globally, an estimated one billion people have no access to essential health-care 
services. The campaign aims to raise awareness of this issue and underpins MEDAICA’s mission.  
TEAM 
MEDAICA’s founding team has a rare mix of proven MedTech, healthcare, hardware, software and finance experience, both in 
global B2B and B2C businesses. 
 
STEPHEN RANDALL, CEO:  
A  serial  entrepreneur  with global   experience   building 
technology               platform businesses,    Stephen    was 
COO      of M3dicine,      a MedTech  device  company, 
CEO   of   LocaModa   Inc.,   a Digital      Out      of      Home 
platform                  company (acquired       by       Monster 
Media) a founder, COO and EVP of Symbian, the mobile 
OS  company  and  Joint  CEO of   Psion   Software   PLC.,   a  
mobile                   computing company. 
MARK GRETTON, CTO:  
Mark  has  over  thirty  years of  technology  management 
including                       senior  management/CTO  roles  at 
Psion      PLC      where      he developed  one  of  the  first 
ARM     based     application specific processor chips and 
TomTom    N.V.   where   he built  the  engineering  team 
that developed         the company’s ground-breaking 
range    of    navigation    and Health-tech    devices    with 
over a 100m units sold.  
CLIVE MILLINGTON, COO:  
Consumer  and  Technology Products   expert   who   has 
deployed            >100million connected  devices  globally 
(Satnav,    Health-tech and Sports  wearables).  Former 
CEO   of   AYR   and   COO   of TomTom  N.V.  with  over  35 
years’ experience  in early-stage companies through to 
IPO    and    onto    consumer brands          with          global 
recognition. Builder of high-performance      companies, 
products and teams. 
PABLO RIVAS, CFO/CRO:  
Before MEDAICA,   Pablo   was CFO  at  M3dicine, a  MedTech 
company and    CEO    of    the largest    American    chain    of 
Hospitals  in  Mexico.  With  15 years’ experience  in  M&A  at 
European and American banks, he    led    multiple    deals    in 
Healthcare, Biotech,    Health Insurance  and  Pharma. Pablo 
holds  a  Wharton  MBA,  MA  in International     Studies     from 
Univ. of Penn- Lauder Institute and post grad. degree in Mgmt. 
from Harvard University. Angel investor in over 10 companies. 
DAN GIESCHEN, CPO:  
Founder     and     Head     of Product   at   Double   Down 
Interactive     (acquired     by IGT).                    Experienced 
developing,   launching   and scaling       technology       for 
companies  including  the  US Dept   of   Education,   Citgo, 
Canon,  Konica  Minolta  and Kimberley   Clark.   Head   of 
Technology  for  Drop  in  the Bucket, a non-profit building 
wells        and        sanitations systems at schools in Africa. 
Board  member  at  IndieFlix Group Inc. Angel Investor. 
NICK   GIESCHEN,   HEAD of SOFTWARE:  
Founder   and   Head   of Software      at      Double 
Down              Interactive (acquired  by  IGT)  where 
he         led platform development            from 
concept,   launch,   scale and exit. Prior to Double 
Down,        20+        years developing         software 
platforms    for    startups and        Fortune        500 
companies.              Angel investor. 
ADVISORS:  
DR. ALISA NIKSCH, MD – Telehealth and Clinical Advisor: Assistant Professor of  Pediatrics and  Pediatric  Cardiology,  Tufts  University  School  of  Medicine,  Chief  Medical  Officer, 
Genetesis,  Inc.,  Team  Lead-Supply  Chain  and  Strategic  partnerships,  GetUsPPE,  Clinical Advisory Board Member- AliveCor, Inc., Scientific Advisor- Genetesis, Inc., Fellow, Doximity, 
Inc., Chair, Women in Digital Health Initiative, MassChallenge. 
DR.  JENNIFER  JOE,  MD – Telehealth  and  Clinical  Advisor: ER  Physician,    Digital  Health  & Telemedicine  KoL.  Founder  and  Editor-in-Chief  of  MedTech  Boston, American  Medical 
Women's  Association,  Member,  Health  and  Public  Policy  Committee,  American  College  of Physicians,   MIT   Media   Lab,   Senior   Medical   Science   Liaison,   Barkey   GmbH,   Principal, 
Vanguard Health. 
DR. REGINA S. DRUZ, MD, FACC, FASNC – Digital  Health Advisor: Chair, American College of Cardiology, Healthcare Innovation section; BOD American Society Nuclear Cardiology; Director, 
Integrative Cardiology Center at St. Francis Hospital, Catholic Health Service (NY). 
DR.  GLENN  TUCKER,  MD – Telehealth  and  Clinical  Advisor: Former  Chair,  Committee  on Information Technology, Massachusetts Medical Society. Board Certified in Internal Medicine 
and Diplomate in Clinical Informatics. Specialties: Medical practice, primary care, health care IT, electronic health records. 
MICHAEL DRUES – Regulatory Advisor: President Vascular Sciences, Regulatory Consultant to FDA, Health Canada, HSA (Singapore). Adjunct Professor Cornell University (Dept. BioMedical 
Engineering) and George Washington University (School of Medicine and Health Sciences). 
IP 
The Company has 4 patent applications:  
1) Health hub using unique web-links to control access rights and enable additional services such as but not limited to 
diagnostic analysis, user verification, third party access rights, sharing/viewing rules and financial controls. 
2) Telehealth audio methods including separate auscultation and user/room microphones.  
3) High   level   healthcare   programming   environment enabling   device/exam   instructions,   reminders   and   message 
notifications to be  "chained"  together  to  help doctors  and  healthcare  organizations  produce  simple healthcare 
management protocols for remote patient care. 
4) Telehealth self-exam methods including tagging sounds to body map positions, doctor remote controls and patient self-
exam augmented reality positioning. 
MEDAICA will continue putting significant resources on IP and patents as we believe innovation is core to our Mission. 
Full patent details available on request.

{"id_":"TxyG/s5yKFcV41uE8ddJUG0wbU3V13c9hB/RqkqxaPY=","metadata":{},"excludedEmbedMetadataKeys":[],"excludedLlmMetadataKeys":[],"relationships":{},"hash":"D5ruYHuR4j5lZMX90tCqH6RsMza790AfulWzS9GQBQ0=","text":"
     
Medaica M1 Telehealth Stethoscope Software, Professional User Guide EN 
                                                    
© 2022 Medaica Inc. All Rights Reserved                Page 2 of 13 
 
INTRODUCTION 
Thank you for choosing Medaica Telehealth Software. Medaica Telehealth Software has been designed to enable healthcare 
providers to perform auscultation remotely; either by guiding patients who have a Medaica M1 Telehealth Stethoscope over a 
video call or by reviewing Store and Forward auscultation files recorded by patients or other healthcare professionals with a 
Medica M1 Telehealth Stethoscope. 
The Medaica M1 Telehealth Stethoscope delivers the latest in telehealth technology with ambient noise reduction, an 
auscultation microphone for body sounds, a voice microphone for speaking during telehealth video sessions and plug and play 
ease-of-use for Patient Store and Forward or clinician-guided live exams.  
Please use this manual if you are a) conducting telehealth exams and wish to auscultate remote patients who are using the 
Medaica M1 Telehealth Stethoscope or b) reviewing exams recorded on the Medaica M1 Telehealth Stethoscope and sent to 
you as Patient Store and Forward exams.  
For the purpose of this manual, the term Healthcare Providers includes but is not limited to clinicians, professional caregivers, 
nurses, nurse practitioners, physical and occupational therapists and home care aides and assumes at the very least, minimal 
experience to auscultate a patient and enter a patient’s information into a computer.  
NOTE: For healthcare providers wanting to use the Medaica M1 Telehealth Stethoscope M1 on patients directly (rather than 
remotely) to record store and forward exams, please refer to the Medaica Telehealth Stethoscope User Manual which is 
available at medaica.com. 
 
SAFETY INFORMATION 
Please read and follow all safety information in these instructions prior to using M1 Telehealth Stethoscope Software. Please 
refer to the Medaica M1 Telehealth Stethoscope for device safety information.   
 
Retain these instructions for future reference. 
 
CAUTIONS & WARNINGS 
• To reduce the risks associated with an incorrect result, operate this stethoscope software only as instructed in this manual. 
• Interpreting auscultation sounds requires professional training. The Medaica M1 Telehealth Stethoscope is not made for self-diagnosis and results should be referred to a professional. 
• Please read the User Manual and follow in-app instructions.  
If you have any questions about using the M1 Telehealth device or software, please contact either your retailer or Medaica Customer Care at suppport@medaica.com  
","textTemplate":"","metadataSeparator":"
","type":"DOCUMENT"}

KS1/Ym5wcAYo5Q/Uyc05hyeAZegkjBZu7e7XFQeO.__data__:

Medaica M1 Telehealth Stethoscope Software, Professional User Guide EN 
                                                    
© 2022 Medaica Inc. All Rights Reserved                Page 3 of 13 
 
INTENDED USE 
The Medaica M1 Telehealth Stethoscope is an electronic stethoscope that enables transmission of auscultation sound data, 
whereby a clinician at one location on an IP network can listen to the auscultation sounds of a patient on site or at a different 
location on the IP network with the signal carried on an IP connection between the two locations. The Medica M1 Telehealth 
Stethoscope is intended to be used by professional users in a clinical environment or by lay users in a nonclinical environment. 
The device is for medical diagnostics purposes only. The device is not intended for self-diagnosis.  
CONTRAINDICATIONS 
None known.  
 
 
 
  
","textTemplate":"","metadataSeparator":"
","type":"DOCUMENT"}

iSkd89ENJHrK2/rOxnZZybsZkOIQkdhOmFSQ/IMG.__data__:
{"id_":"iSkd89ENJHrK2/rOxnZZybsZkOIQkdhOmFSQ/IMG3BU=","metadata":{},"excludedEmbedMetadataKeys":[],"excludedLlmMetadataKeys":[],"relationships":{},"hash":"//x41uN+6bx5w4v9zIkZXhFTQu0Zih4r0l7ml7tGnC4=","text":"
     
Medaica M1 Telehealth Stethoscope Software, Professional User Guide EN 
                                                    
© 2022 Medaica Inc. All Rights Reserved                Page 4 of 13 
 
INSTRUCTIONS FOR USE 
 
 
HOW THE MEDAICA SYSTEM WORKS 
The M1 stethoscope connects to the patient’s computer (Apple or Windows) or mobile device (iPhone, iPad or Android) to 
communicate with their healthcare provider via an internet connection.  
Instructions for using the M1 stethoscope are available at mediaca.com. 
The Medica software that works with the M1 stethoscope enables two types of remote exams;  
Live Exams are conducted with a healthcare provider remotely guiding the patient via a telehealth session, listening to their 
heart and/or lung sounds and recording that data, subject to the patient’s permission.  
Store and Forward (Self) Exams are done in the patient’s own time, recording heart and/or lung sounds and then sending those 
results to their healthcare provider. 
Live Exams and Store and Forward Exams use the same approach and are described in detail in the following pages.

system requirements. Visit: www.medaica.com/help for more information on system requirements.

Create a Healthcare Provider account and/or Log In at medaica.com.  
Once you Log In, you can access your Account Settings, Patient records and 
Exams.  
Account Settings is where you can change your password and email 
settings.  
Patients is where you add/edit patient information in the system and  
Exams is where you control exam settings. 
 
3.  Create a New Patient Entry 
Select Patients  
Select New Patient  
Add the patient details 
Select Save Changes 
Select Save.  
 
 
 
4.  Patient Store and Forward Exam  
A Store and Forward Exam is an exam a Patient can 
conduct in their own time for the specific 
auscultation positions you require.  
Confirm patient has read and understood 
the  instructions before asking them to 
perform a Store and Forward exam.  Store 
and Forward exam.  
Confirm patient has successfully used the 
M1 Stethoscope in a Live Exam before 
asking them to use it in a Store and Forward 
Exam. 
To create a Store and Forward exam: 
Select Patients in the sidebar 
Select Create Store and Forward Exam 
Select Patient Details to see an existing list of Patients or add them as a new patient. 
Select Save Changes

{"id_":"O0a/fsLZtwGQWLNX2h1SLTzdbholotkMKx6oY6TDl3o=","metadata":{},"excludedEmbedMetadataKeys":[],"excludedLlmMetadataKeys":[],"relationships":{},"hash":"6wUE0dTvH1bmBHQ+pC1WlctYrHNGmCvcdj/CLwKT2Mk=","text":"

You will now be able to see and hear the patient and can guide on the correct placement of the stethoscope as you record their 
auscultation sounds. 
 
 As you face your screen, you are looking at a mirrored image of yourself and a facing image of your patient (i.e. as if 
the patient is facing you). Your patient will see your image unmirrored, as if you are facing them. You can turn off 
Mirroring in settings.  
 If the patient has not plugged in their M1 Stethoscope, or it is not recognized by their system (see Troubleshooting), 
you and the patient will see an on-screen prompt “please plug in your M1 Stethoscope”  
 
You have control over the stethoscope’s listen/record function. 
Press Listen to hear the patient’s auscultation sounds and start 
recording 
 
 
 
 
  
 Recording Quality: In order to achieve a high quality and clear recording of heart and/or lung sounds, 
remind the patient: 
• To make sure they are in a quiet location 
• not to move the stethoscope during recording and  
• not to speak during the recording.  
 For listening back to the recorded body sounds, connect high quality over-the-ear headphones to your 
computer or mobile device. Open style headphones, ear buds, computer or mobile device loudspeakers 
are not suitable for listening to low frequency auscultation sounds.

cDBxmJZ3hNKGjoatehOT9fxZWq5seO5msC5IK4FP.__data__:
{"id_":"cDBxmJZ3hNKGjoatehOT9fxZWq5seO5msC5IK4FPlQ4=","metadata":{},"excludedEmbedMetadataKeys":[],"excludedLlmMetadataKeys":[],"relationships":{},"hash":"k6KsAvnSpgFOcZdIWyEfAcFthw/0K1Oawjr/W6/VC/k=","text":"
     
Medaica M1 Telehealth Stethoscope Software, Professional User Guide EN 
                                                    
© 2022 Medaica Inc. All Rights Reserved                Page 11 of 13 
 
6. Frequently Asked Questions and Troubleshooting 
Can the patient use the M1 Stethoscope with any telehealth system? 
Telehealth systems that run in a web browser work with M1 on an Apple Mac, Windows PC or Android mobile device. Many 
telehealth systems that also work on mobile apps will also work with M1, but some iOS telehealth apps might not be 
compatible.   
Can the patient use the Mi Stethoscope with any laptop or mobile device? 
Yes, as long as your laptop or mobile device meets the Minimum System Requirements. 
Why can’t I login to the Medaica App?  
Try checking your user login details (username/password). Make sure you have internet connection on your computer of 
mobile device. 
Make sure that your Internet connection is working properly and that your computer or mobile device is connected to it.  
Make sure that you have the right name and password for your Internet access 
Make sure you have the right name and password for your medaica.com account. 
If the above does not resolve your problem, please contact Medaica Support.  
I’ve forgotten my password; how do I access my account?  
Click Login, then Click on “Forgot Password.”  
If the above does not resolve your problem, please contact Medaica Support.  
How do I get the patient to record a good signal for their exam?  
Ask the patient to take the exam in a quiet location. 
They need to eliminate as much external noise as possible during the exam.  
They must not move the device on the body during recording.  
They must make sure the device is in full contact with and placed firmly on their body or over a light shirt. 
They must use the device on their skin or over a thin shirt or tee shirt. 
They must not use the device over thick clothing. 
If the above does not resolve their problem, please contact Medaica Support. 
For more support information, visit: www.medaica.com/support and/or email support@medaica.com 
 
 
  
","textTemplate":"","metadataSeparator":"
","type":"DOCUMENT"}

security features that are compliant with HIPAA policies. Third party access may be prohibited to such information 
without obtaining written authorization from the patient. The user is fully responsible for understanding and 
following all laws that regulate storage, transmission, and disclosure of any electronic patient data through the use 
of software. If the user becomes unable to comply with a law or restriction that applies to use and disclosure of 
such data, the user should not proceed to collect or save such information. This application may require entry of 
individually identifiable health information in order to function. Records are stored and recalled through the use of 
patient name, date of birth, and/or patient ID #. By entering this information, the user assumes any and all risks of 
and liabilities  incurred  with  using  or  transmitting  such information

{"id_":"vOUpqxVS8NwPuE0MgFBxICJWODgXuOoCfgI46xgSlcQ=","metadata":{},"excludedEmbedMetadataKeys":[],"excludedLlmMetadataKeys":[],"relationships":{},"hash":"YVKRB6zW1q5VDWqiYJjGAxbuw/NqdZ/KnQGl5HmJX4g=","text":" 
  
Medaica receives FDA clearance for M1 Telehealth Stethoscope 
Consumer stethoscope makes “digital house calls” possible over telehealth 
 
HENDERSON, NV, USA, Jan. 20, 2023 - Medaica, a digital health company, extending the 
capability of home diagnostics, today announced its Medaica M1 Telehealth Stethoscope has 
received U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) 510(k) clearance.
1
 
The Medaica M1 Telehealth Stethoscope (M1) has been cleared for Over-the-Counter (OTC) use 
by consumers. M1 is a plug-and-play solution for a patient to connect to a doctor, who can then 
listen to a remote patients’ hearts, lungs, or other organ sounds over a telehealth visit, as easily 
and clearly as if they were in the same room.  
“A medical exam that would otherwise require either an expensive proprietary system or an in-
person appointment, can now be a simple and standard feature of any telehealth visit,” said 
Stephen Randall, CEO of Medaica. “We can make a doctor’s ‘digital house call’ something that 
anyone, anywhere has access to.” 
Interoperability with 3
rd
 party telehealth systems is built into the Medaica solution and is 
becoming a requirement that many healthcare organizations including the American Telehealth 
Association 
2
 recognize as fundamental to realizing the full potential of digital health. 
The Medaica M1 Telehealth Stethoscope is bundled with a complete end-to-end digital 
diagnostics and telehealth solution for providers who want the full capability of using M1 for 
remote auscultation with best-in-class telehealth features, in one integrated solution.  
Medaica has been working with several leading hospitals and clinics to support their healthcare 
initiatives including Emory Hospital, Georgia.   
Dr Byron Williams Jr., Emeritus Chief of Medicine at Emory University Hospital commented, 
“Providing affordable and accessible healthcare solutions to our rural patients is one of our 
biggest challenges. Medaica’s M1 Telehealth stethoscope enhances our remote care, making it 
possible for us to conduct post-acute follow-up telehealth exams, resulting in greater efficiencies 
and more affordable healthcare.”  
For more details on how Medaica M1 Telehealth Stethoscope please contact 1-888-MEDAICA (1-
888-633-2422),  info@medaica.com or visit www.medaica.com.  
1. https://www.accessdata.fda.gov/cdrh_docs/pdf22/K223166.pdf 
2. American Telehealth Association: “Telehealth Interoperability” White Paper 
https://www.americantelemed.org/initiatives/interoperability/ 
 
 
","textTemplate":"","metadataSeparator":"
","type":"DOCUMENT"}

{"id_":"ksAmreMRIf+OvvYJmxyVqTF2qT+Ov4LFJomW13Cj7ZU=","metadata":{},"excludedEmbedMetadataKeys":[],"excludedLlmMetadataKeys":[],"relationships":{},"hash":"CO5yMZzxcz0NrttW71s15yUi4D6mFwL3puxh01aZn1c=","text":" 
  
Medaica Announces Free FDA-Cleared M1 Telehealth 
Stethoscope for Rural and Underserved Patients 
First free FDA-cleared digital stethoscope for consumers 
 
HENDERSON, NV, USA, April 13, 2023 /PRNewswire/ - Medaica, a digital health company 
extending the capability of home diagnostics, today announced that the Medaica M1 Telehealth 
Stethoscope (M1) will be free of charge, starting with qualifying strategic partners supporting 
rural or underserved patients with chronic heart and/or lung conditions.  
Medaica is the first company to provide a free U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) cleared 
1
 
digital stethoscope for in-home use. The M1 stethoscope has been designed with a focus on 
being patient-centric, affordable, and interoperable. Most existing digital stethoscopes are 
designed for clinicians, not patients, and are proprietary, so do not work with existing telehealth 
systems. 
“By making the Medica M1 Telehealth Stethoscope free for rural and underserved patients, we 
aim to accelerate awareness of and access to more a compelling remote healthcare option for 
those who need it the most,” said Stephen Randall, CEO of Medaica. “We believe that 
telehealth’s ultimate potential will be realized when millions of patients can be examined as 
effectively on-line as they can in clinic. Consumerizing the stethoscope is the first step in making 
that a reality, while reducing the burden of understaffed clinics.” 
• Nearly 80% of rural America is medically underserved. With fewer than 40 physicians per 
100,000 people, a problem that is getting worse every year as the population gets older and 
more healthcare workers leave the profession.
2
  
• Physician demand continues to outstrip supply, leading to a projected shortage of between 
37,800 and 124,000 physicians by 2034 with the most alarming gaps in primary care and rural 
communities, according to the Association of American Medical Colleges.
3  
 
Dr. Jennifer Peña, former White House physician under both the Obama and Trump 
administrations and member of the American Telemedicine Association's Advisory Group to 
Eliminate Healthcare Disparities and Inequalities, who recently joined Medaica as its Chief 
Medical Officer commented, “Prior to the Medaica M1 Telehealth Stethoscope, the ability to 
auscultate a patient using telehealth was expensive and complicated. Giving patients a simple 
and free FDA-cleared stethoscope for remote telehealth exams is a game changer, especially for 
the many who can’t so easily travel to the clinic.” 
The Medaica M1 Telehealth Stethoscope is bundled with Medaica Telehealth+, a complete 
digital diagnostics and telehealth solution for providers in one solution. For interoperability with 
existing telehealth systems, M1 can be used without requiring any specific customization or 
integration. 
","textTemplate":"","metadataSeparator":"
","type":"DOCUMENT"}

Medaica Launches Telehealth+ Remote Diagnostics Platform  
Designed to unburden clinics, Telehealth+ offers affordable remote auscultation and diagnostics 
modules 
 
HENDERSON, NV, USA, Mar 28, 2023 -  Medaica, a digital health company, extending the 
capability of home diagnostics, today launched Telehealth+, a remote auscultation and 
diagnostics platform, designed to unburden clinics via affordable and simple clinical-grade 
remote exams.  
Telehealth+ comes bundled with Medaica’s M1 Telehealth Stethoscope,
 
an FDA-cleared 
1 stethoscope for Over-the-Counter (OTC) use by consumers and is available as a complete 
telehealth system or in modules that are interoperable with existing telehealth systems. 
“With Telehealth+ and the FDA-cleared Medaica M1 Telehealth Stethoscope, providers can now 
extend auscultation to anyone with an internet connected device,” said Stephen Randall, CEO of 
Medaica. “We envision a new generation of telehealth applications that provide much more than 
simple video calls. For millions of patients and their providers, clinical-grade exams via what we 
could call ‘Telehealth 2.0,’ has the power to democratize access to healthcare and help 
unburden clinics.” 
For more details on how the Medaica M1 Telehealth Stethoscope and Medaica Telehealth+ can 
enhance telehealth offerings, please contact 1-888-MEDAICA (1-888-633-2422),  
info@medaica.com or visit www.medaica.com.

About eMurmur 
eMurmur is a technology partner to the global healthcare community specializing in advanced 
digital auscultation. Supporting heart, lung, and bowel health screenings, the company seeks to 
elevate the practice of auscultation in every interaction. eMurmur partners with leading 
hardware and telehealth providers to integrate high-definition auscultation technology into 
healthcare practice, whether delivering in-home, in-clinic, or virtual care. Using advanced 
engineering, eMurmur makes it possible for healthcare providers performing auscultation to 
screen, monitor, diagnose, and consult with greater certainty. 
For more information, visit: https://emurmur.com/

Andreas Schriefl

{"id_":"./datasources/medaica/Medaica website.html","metadata":{},"excludedEmbedMetadataKeys":[],"excludedLlmMetadataKeys":[],"relationships":{},"hash":"IpYTHJP0214uZp+lLM+gBbVALzrA7VQSGzS0kfHk0+I=","text":"Medaica | Virtual Health

top of page

Contact Us About us Insights Products Providers Patients Jobs News Blog More Use tab to navigate through the menu items. MEDAICA is a digital health company extending the reach and capability of remote care We believe everyone should have simple and affordable access to healthcare.

See how we're making that happen. Medaica Telehealth+ Diagnostic Platform Insights Medaica’s platform and products are designed for interoperability to help future-proof our partners' operations.

Affordable FDA cleared M1 Telehealth Stethoscope designed for consumer scale and FREE for strategic partners supporting rural, or underserved patients and chronic heart and/or lung conditions.

Simple Ease of use for patients, minimal workflow changes for healthcare professionals.

Accessible Plug & play, interoperable with any telemedicine platform. insights Insights There is a huge gap between willingness to use Telehealth and actual use in most medical specialties due to lack of easy to use, affordable and compatible platforms and relevant devices. Sci-Fi's vision of the future included systems that could diagnose patients instantly. Reality is getting there but the devil is in the details.

​

Several digital devices and platforms today can diagnose a few conditions, but most are proprietary, expensive, difficult to use and rarely regulated for home use by consumers.

​

In our opinion (and the opinion of thought-leaders at the American Telehealth Association, American Medical Association, Centers for Disease Control and Prevention and Healthcare Information and Management Systems Society) we need platforms that support:

​

Interoperability of software and hardware to enable healthcare providers and patients to use any solutions that work with their existing systems.

Patient-centric design to deliver ease of use at an affordable price with regulatory clearance for “Over the Counter” home use and

An open ecosystem to support ever-changing and emerging 3rd Party AI, tools and devices.

358M Households USA, EU & UK ​

358M Households in the USA and Western Europe.
EU 195M
USA 133 M
UK 30M

​ ​

​

World Bank 2020 ~$250B ​

​

McKinsey 2021 ​

~20% of Medicare, Medicaid, Outpatient, Office and Home Health spend could be virtualized.

​ Growth of "Digital First" 82% Consumer Digital Health ​

82% of consumers view digital options as the best way to monitor health

​ ​

​

McKinsey 2021 94% Interoperability ​

94% of healthcare professionals believe interoperability is critical.

​ ​

​

Deloitte Insights 2020 860M ​

​

CDC Fact Sheet 2019 Physician Office Visits in USA in 2019 ​

503M Primary Care consultations in USA in 2019.

​ 85% ​

209,000 Primary Care Physicians in USA

​ Adults visited a Dr. last year ​

​

CDC Fact Sheet 2019 1.4M Patients in Licensed Nursing Homes in USA in 2019

​

​ ​

​

CDC Fact Sheet 2019 65M 20% people in the USA have been diagnosed with heart disease 27M, Asthma 25M, COPD 23M. ​

​

CDC Fact Sheet 2019 products Medaica Telehealth+ Telehealth diagnostic platform with FREE FDA-cleared stethoscope for remote auscultation.

​

- Improve the efficiency of supporting remote patients with more exam data and better outcomes.

​

Medaica Telehealth+ is an affordable and effective way for providers to extend their remote health capabilities.

​

More than basic telehealth video conferencing, Medaica Telehealth+ is a connected care platform that combines audio/video features with diagnostic tools and an FDA-cleared, Over The Counter (OTC) stethoscope, specifically designed for plug-and-play remote auscultation, so healthcare professionals can listen to a remote patient as easily and clearly as if they were in the clinic. MEDAICA TELEHEALTH+ FEATURES
Cloud-based telehealth platform

Works with Chrome or any browser supporting Web RTC.

Supported platforms: iOS 15 and up, iPadOS 15 and up, Android 12 and up, Windows 10 and up, MacOS 10 and up.

Live, Store and Forward, Scheduled and In-Person.

Nurse assisted.

3rd Party AI diagnostic support.

Secure. encrypted end-to-end, HIPAA compliant.

M1 Telehealth Stethoscope.

FDA cleared 510(k), Class II, OTC, intended to be used by professional users in a clinical environment or by lay users 18+ (and approved for over 65 yrs old) in a nonclinical environment.

Specifically designed for remote auscultation, patented two microphone design for intuitive multi-modal patient/ provider communications and auscultation recording.

Frequency response 20 - 3,500 Hz.

USB-C with included USB-2 and Lightning adapters.

Live-stream and near real-time lossless upload.

PCG visualization.

FREE for strategic partners supporting rural, or underserved patients and chronic heart and/or lung conditions.

Save and share recordings allowing for benchmarking, longitudinal and cohort comparisons.

Noise reduction: ambient, room and frictional.

Dimensions 134.5 x 17.5 x 33.4 mm.

IP24.

Healthcare Provider interface includes stethoscope volume, bell, diaphragm and extended filters, auscultation position customization, auscultation notes, patient messaging, waiting room, patient present alert, and export to EMR.

Remotely detect patient’s stethoscope status and record start/stop.

Use Cases

Remote exams (e.g. rural, schools, corporate), Chronic patient follow up, reduce readmissions, clinical education, in field EMS triage and clinical support.

HOW TO BUY

Medaica Telehealth+ is available via RPM or telehealth partners or sold to HCPs as either an annual license on a per visit/per stethoscope or per host model. The FDA cleared Medaica M1 Stethoscope is also available FREE for strategic partners supporting rural, or underserved patients and chronic heart and/or lung conditions. Contact us. Contact Us End-to-End Virtual Care Use Cases Our Cause MEDAICA is working on a cause-driven campaign under the banner of EveryBeatEveryBreath.org, to provide telehealth solutions with free stethoscopes to remote, underserved communities and disadvantaged groups.

In the USA, nearly 53 million people (16% of population) live more than 30 miles from a hospital or urgent care. Globally, an estimated one billion people have no access to essential health-care services.

The campaign aims to raise awareness of this issue and underpins MEDAICA’s Mission "to extend the reach and capability of remote care” and Vision that “Everyone in the world has affordable access to healthcare.”

Contact us to learn more.

​

EveryBeatEveryBreath.org Cause About us

We are passionate about making remote care available to everyone, simply and affordably.

Medaica was founded by serial entrepreneurs with multiple successful exits, a combined 50+ years in health technology and medical businesses and over 100 years in software platforms.

Our team has the unique experience of designing, developing and shipping innovative, robust, secure and scalable software and consumer electronics, used by hundreds of millions of people worldwide.

We have helped catalyze change in other industries and we are working to do the same in digital health. Starting by making it more open and interoperable, enabling AI and other products and services to leverage data.

Ultimately, we believe open platforms will accelerate innovation and lead to more efficient and more affordable healthcare and better outcomes. For everyone.

​

Partnerships are critical to achieving what we're building.

Please contact us to learn more. about-us Leadership STEPHEN RANDALL

CEO Stephen is serial entrepreneur with global experience building technology platform businesses. Prior to Medaica, he was COO of M3dicine, a MedTech device company and CEO of LocaModa Inc., a Digital Out of Home platform company (acquired by Monster Media). Stephen was also a Founder and COO of Symbian, the mobile OS platform company jointly owned by Nokia, Sony Ericsson, Motorola, Matsushita, Motorola and Psion (acquired by Nokia), Joint CEO of Psion Software PLC., a mobile computing company and Founder/CEO of Eden Group (acquired by Geoworks). He is a recipient of the British Design Award for the Stepp Digital Guitar. Architecture - Cardiff University. PABLO RIVAS

President / CFO Before MEDAICA, Pablo was CFO at M3dicine a MedTech company and CEO of AmeriMed, the largest chain of American hospitals in Mexico where he led the company turnaround. With 15 years of experience in M&A at European and American banks, he led multiple cross-border deals in Healthcare, Biotech, Health Insurance and Pharma.  Besides Medaica, he co-founded 2 companies in the technology space, both currently in growth stage and advised many others. Angel investor. Pablo holds a Wharton MBA, MA in International Studies from Univ. of Penn/Lauder Institute and a post-grad degree in Mgmt. from Harvard University. CLIVE MILLINGTON

COO Consumer and technology product expert who has deployed >100million connected devices in over 40 countries globally (Satnav, Health-tech and Sports wearables). Former CEO of AYR and over 12 years as COO of TomTom N.V., digital map and content provider.

Over 35 years’ experience in early-stage companies through to IPO and onto consumer brands with global recognition.

Builder of high-performance companies, products and teams. Deep expertise in supply chain and operations management.

MBA - Univ. Hertfordshire. MARK GRETTON

CTO Mark has over thirty years of technology management including senior  management/CTO roles at several start ups including  Psion PLC where he developed one of the first ARM based application specific processor chips. Former CTO of TomTom N.V. where he led the transition from a small software company into a large international consumer electronics brand. He built the engineering team that developed the company’s ground-breaking range of navigation and Health-tech devices with over a 100m units sold. BSc Engineering - University of Reading. DR. JENNIFER PEÑA

Chief Medical Officer Dr. Peña served as White House physician under both the Obama and Trump administrations, and Physician to the Vice President of the United States. A former US Army combat veteran, Dr. Peña is a digital and telehealth expert, clinical leader and board-certified internal medicine physician. Dr. Peña directs the Vidalús free clinic of the Boys and Girls Club of Puerto Rico and is a fellow of the American College of Physicians (ACP) and member of the American Telemedicine Association's Advisory Group to Eliminate Healthcare Disparities and Inequalities. BS-Yale University. MD-University of Pittsburgh School of Medicine. Residency-Walter Reed Army Medical Center. NICK GIESCHEN

Head of Software Before MEDAICA, Nick was founder and Head of Software at Double Down Interactive (acquired by IGT) an entertainment software company.

Nick led platform development from concept, and launch, to scale to 4.7 million monthly active users and exit ($500M). Prior to Double Down Interactive, Nick had 20+ years developing software platforms for startups and Fortune 100 companies such as IBM, AT&T, and Intel. Angel investor.

BA, Philosophy and Literature – Univ of Toronto DAN GIESCHEN

Head of Product 20+ years experience developing high-end technology applications and solutions. Before MEDAICA Dan was CPO of iPro and helped develop the product. Prior to iPro, Dan was founder and Head of Product at Double Down Interactive (acquired by IGT) an entertainment software company that he helped to grow to support over 1 million daily players, 100+ employees, and one of the top grossing iPad and Facebook applications. Dan is also Head of Technology for Drop in the Bucket, a non-profit building wells and sanitations systems at schools in Africa. Board member at IndieFlix Group Inc. Angel Investor. Berklee College of Music Clinical Advisory Board Medaica’s Clinical Advisory Board help the company continuously improve our products

by identifying areas where we add the most value to providers and patients.

The board comprises world-renowned clinicians spanning the The White House Medical Unit,

Emory, USCSF and the International Institute of Cardiology. Dr. Byron Williams Jr. is Emeritus Chief of Medicine    at Emory University Hospital. He received his medical degree from University of Florida College of Medicine. Dr. Vicente Bertomeu is the Dean of Cardiology at UMH in Elche (Spain) and the Head of the Cardiology Research Center    at San Juan University  Hospital, Alicante, Spain. Dr. Jennifer Peña served as White House physician under both the Obama and Trump administrations, and Physician to the Vice President of the United States. A digital and telehealth expert, clinical leader and board-certified internal medicine physician. Julie Gregg is a Certified Registered Nurse Anesthetist at the Veterans Administration in the USA and is a Principal Investigator for research investigating systolic and diastolic duration. Laurie McGraw is a recognized healthcare leader, previously American Medical Association (AMA) SVP; President AMA Innovations; President at Allscripts. Dr. Danny Weiss is a cardiac electrophysiologist and an author of “An in vitro acoustic analysis and comparison of popular stethoscopes” a leading peer reviewed white paper for digital stethoscope performance testing. Dr. Adithya Cattamanchi is Professor of Medicine and Epidemiology at UCSF and UC Irvine. He also conducts research with the Gates Foundation focused on  diagnostics for tuberculosis. Dr. Cordero is a sports cardiologist and a Professor of the International Institute of Cardiology. He is the author of numerous publications as well as the Head of the Cardiac  Rehabilitation of the Spanish Cardiology Society. Dr. Tony Das is a nationally recognized board-certified interventional cardiology specialist who has been leading national programs to incorporate remote monitoring to improve care for cardiovascular patients by reducing hospitalizations and office visits Dr. Ivica Duric is the Head of the Arrhythmology and Electrophysiology Department at the Cardiology Clinic within the Military Medical Academy, Belgrade. Previously, Commander of the emergency medical evacuation team in the EU peacekeeping mission in Mali. Dr Duric's field of interest is heart rhythm disorders.

MEDAICA INC

170 S. Green Valley Parkway, Suite 300
Henderson NV 89012
USA

{"id_":"IfadRCX9L3SzXmgJe3wuzMK6oodCJ96/CpDhJ9p1Qu4=","metadata":{},"excludedEmbedMetadataKeys":[],"excludedLlmMetadataKeys":[],"relationships":{},"hash":"SS5Vz5vX4BsQ1bxTbdfFTRjojCtj1m3//7MGzsmt6Mk=","text":"Early diagnosis and management of chronic heart and lung conditions.

1 person dies every 33 secs of cardiovascular disease. 
7 in 10 deaths are from chronic disease. 
>50% of the population live with chronic disease.

Early diagnosis saves lives 
and money.  
$3.3 Trillion (80%) U.S health care spent on chronic disease.

We can do better... 
Low-cost interoperable digital sensors + smart software can detect: 
Murmurs

endocarditis), Blood clots and stroke, Fainting, Heart attack, Sudden cardiac arrest, Fever, 
Anemia, or Valvular Heart Disease (VHD). 
A narrow valve -  possibly due to aortic stenosis.  
- Hear murmurs, tell which valve is in trouble, evaluate the severity. 
Valve leakage.  
- Hear the tell-tale sounds of a leaky valve, pinpoint which valve is leaking  and the amount of 
blood leaking. 
Arrhythmias.  
- Normal or abnormal heart rhythm called an arrhythmia, like atrial fibrillation. 
No other company offers low-cost, interoperable digital sensors + smart software... 
No other platform enables affordable access to early diagnosis

Medaica Virtual Healthcare Ecosystem 
Low-cost sensors + Simple virtual/remote triage software + Interoperability of 3

Former founder of eKuore, first wireless digital stethoscope company. 10+ years experience

Intellectual Property 
Virtual Healthcare Exam Systems and Methods - PENDING 
Systems and methods are provided to enable a healthcare professional to conduct a remote 
exam from any web-enabled audio and/or video platform, not only simplifying telemedicine 
consultations that would otherwise require special devices and/or integration of disparate 
systems but also increasing the value of the telemedicine consultation.  
Virtual Healthcare Audio Systems and Methods - PENDING 
A second “room” microphone is added to a telemedicine audio exam device such as but not 
limited to a stethoscope. One embodiment of such as system includes the ability for the patient 
to maintain communications with a healthcare professional even if their device is placed on 
their body. The healthcare professional and/or the system can switch the room microphone off 
when they need better signal to noise for the examination process.  
High Level Healthcare Programming Environment - PENDING 
Instructions, devices and notifications can be "chained" together to help patients perform 
specific healthcare management protocols. For example, such a system could guide a patient to 
use a digital stethoscope to "record heart sounds in Position 3, twice a day, for seven days". 
","textTemplate":"","metadataSeparator":"
