7oYHJpsp+ka6MqaPnmcCBDQeAG2ovOcDGzja3o3e.__data__:
{"id_":"7oYHJpsp+ka6MqaPnmcCBDQeAG2ovOcDGzja3o3eh0I=","metadata":{},"excludedEmbedMetadataKeys":[],"excludedLlmMetadataKeys":[],"relationships":{},"hash":"nXyZJB685OilKPCa7ZPSOlt2RQy8iBt32RzPm8uptfo=","text":"
That specific instruction, frequency and duration can have notifications such that the user is sent 
reminders, and the healthcare professional is sent results.  
Virtual Positioning for Virtual Healthcare Consultations - PENDING 
In a virtual healthcare exam, a healthcare professional can position a digital marker/icon on the 
patient’s remote screen, such that the patient is able to orientate the position of a medical 
sensor. 
Near Real-time Lossless Telehealth Auscultation Audio - PENDING  
In a telehealth exam, audio data may be live-streamed and simultaneously sent to a file 
handling system that downloads the lossless audio data in near real-time. The HCP can then 
access the lossless audio to review the recordings and/or confirm sounds that were heard live. 
Elephant(s) in the Room (The most asked questions) 
Is this an overcrowded space? 
No! There are companies with expensive and proprietary diagnostic tools for doctors or 
companies with limited telehealth 1.0 solutions. NO COMPANY has a platform with inexpensive 
FDA-cleared OTC sensors and interoperable software for patients to access value-based chronic 
cardiac and pulmonary diagnostics. 
Could incumbants copy Medaica strategy? 
Competiting platform are propriatary don‘t have full suite of sensors or are ~$300+ vs 
Medaica‘s free sensors and are all proprietary. Device companies (as opposed to software 
platforms), depend on high hardware margins. Telehealth platforms do not include sensors. 
Changing strategy would be a radical culture, org, tech and margin dispruption. 
Won‘t an army of cheaper sensor companies rush into the market? 
Sensors alone are not the solution. Even when sensors get cheaper (Moore‘s Law), it is much 
more challnging for them to have FDA clearance for OTC, or be interoperable with virtual health 
A/V and AI solutions.  
How are the RPM and/or virtual health markets? 
RPM was worth $14.0 billion in 2023 growing to $41.7 billion by 2028, a CAGR of 20.1 according 
to Markets and Markets, driven by the perfect storm of over-burdened clincs, aging 
populations, expensive healthcare (in USA), and consumer comfort of “Digital First“ will lead to 
remote care that replaces a majority of unnecessary  in-person health visits. Furthrmore, 
Teleheath 2.0 solutions will augmented s/w will replace the limited Telehealth 1.0 and result in 
higher utility and growth. 
Who owns the data? 
Medaica owns the generic, aggregrated, non-identifiable data and has no desire to own 
personally identifiable information. Our licensees own PII. 
How is the data going to be monetized? 
Exams and RPM are monetized. Additionally we will charge for longitudinal data, A.I. analyzed 
data, condition-based applications/services, research applications and ecosystem tariffs for 3rd 
Parties. 
What other conditions/products/services are planned? 
Following HF, chronic pulminary diagnosis applications are planned. Medaica‘s roadmap also 
includes A.I., other sensors, and opening up the platform (OTIS) to 3rd party devices, apps and 
services.  
What are Medaica‘s sustainable competitive advantages? 
","textTemplate":"","metadataSeparator":"
","type":"DOCUMENT"}

eYt8KGiCDnDxjngr1jOiejnJJRyT8ghbZfbdRfi2.__data__:
{"id_":"eYt8KGiCDnDxjngr1jOiejnJJRyT8ghbZfbdRfi2JUA=","metadata":{},"excludedEmbedMetadataKeys":[],"excludedLlmMetadataKeys":[],"relationships":{},"hash":"SPYW+YViTQm8kMA+Q1FV4uYoDy/IK3JB6p7ahBNGyKc=","text":"
FDA clearance, Patents, Free/Scalable consumer device model (Razor/razorblade model), Data 
aggregation (first to get to 10s of millions of HF samples can dominate application and AI area), 
World class team. 
Who‘s your customer? 
RPM, Hopsitals, Clinics and Payors/ACOs, motivated to access and support chronic heart and 
lung patients as well as save on readmissions, or offer better outcomes. Ultimately, the 
consumer will pay for services either directly or via their insurance.  
Won’t Apple, Amazon or Google own this market?  
They are focused on broader healthcare strategies, which not interoperable. Amazon (via One 
Medical) is less device and service centric, so is a more interesting strategic player. If they are 
interested in what we’re doing, they’d be more likely to acquire us.  
What‘s a likely exit? 
Companies like Amazon or Wallmart looking at healthcare as a new consumer market. Google 
looking at the data play. Amwell or Teladoc looking to increase value/reach and stickiness of 
services. Medtronic, Omron, Boston Scientific, etc.  
Is Medaica a hardware or software business? 
Medaica is a software platform business. Specifcally, our platform is the enabling middleware 
glue, connecting endpoints between patients and providers. The sensors are Trojan Horses that 
seed our scale.  
What keeps you up at night? 
Everything! Execution of new models in a traditional market is always challenging. But that‘s 
also the opportunity. 
 
 
 
","textTemplate":"","metadataSeparator":"
","type":"DOCUMENT"}

+KIvfAtHC3+MK8IM89XmDTRrZAuyGf1vl8jUv8RY.__data__:
{"id_":"+KIvfAtHC3+MK8IM89XmDTRrZAuyGf1vl8jUv8RY82k=","metadata":{},"excludedEmbedMetadataKeys":[],"excludedLlmMetadataKeys":[],"relationships":{},"hash":"UCLIYA+RTKMKV1NYgOvnixEQlnOz//P2NH3hoxCe1K4=","text":"INTRODUCTION 
Medaica is a digital health company extending the capability of remote exams over any telehealth 
system, simply and affordably. The Company’s first product is a consumer-focused digital stethoscope, 
designed specifically for telehealth systems at a price point that opens up the power and potential of 
remote care to all users. Medaica was founded by serial entrepreneurs with proven global experience in 
MedTech, Healthcare, Consumer Electronics and scaling mass volume hardware and software platforms.  
THE PROBLEM 
Existing telehealth systems provide video conferencing and/or chat applications, some with scheduling 
management and Electronic Medical Record (EMR) integration. Although telehealth is becoming 
increasingly popular, especially in light of COVID-19, it is currently limited to only a few practice areas, 
such as mental health, dermatology, pediatrics and the common cold. Auscultation is an important part 
of a clinical exam that is missing in telemedicine sessions. Addressing that need, not only has the 
potential to improve the effectiveness of remote care for both the clinician and patient, but also 
improve the utility and value of telehealth. 
Medaica conducted extensive market research to surface the less obvious challenges of developing a 
product that required some level of behavioral change – both from doctors and consumers. Related to 
the introduction of blood pressure devices, pulse oximeters and, more recently, devices like the Kardia 
EKG, where patients use tools previously available only to clinicians, Medaica understood that clinicians 
AND patients need to recognize and want more valuable telemedicine sessions through such devices. 
The question was, would this be an acceptable proposition for both sides of the equation? 
INSIGHTS 
The Medaica design team (based in USA and UK) spoke with many clinicians and received consistent 
feedback that most electronic stethoscopes are too complicated and too expensive for daily use. 
Furthermore, most electronic stethoscopes cleared by the FDA for use by clinicians, are NOT cleared for 
use by a “lay person” and, in a telemedicine session, it would be the patient, not the doctor, using the 
device.  
Medaica also interviewed medical IT staff who are often the ones tasked with “making it work.” IT 
professionals don’t see the “wow” of a new device first but see the increased workload it might present. 
Incumbent proprietary solutions can create workflow silos that become increasingly difficult to manage 
and support. Solution providers need to understand and appreciate the time-consuming process of 
integrating IT services, devices and systems, and must not assume a doctor, clinic, or hospital will 
willingly adopt yet another proprietary solution. If every medical device only works with a specific  
telehealth platform, those devices ultimately become unsupported islands. That is not a sustainable 
strategy for a business or a medical practice.  
At a detailed level, on top of familiar “hot button” issues including but not limited to data privacy and 
development of more telehealth pay-codes etc., examples of the less obvious but real-world challenges 
facing clinicians that also surfaced were: 
• Artificial Intelligence AI, even when positioned as “Assisted Intelligence” which is arguably a 
friendlier and more accurate term of art, was often received as a threat not a benefit; At best it was 
","textTemplate":"","metadataSeparator":"
","type":"DOCUMENT"}

V4iQtTH3f1U0dkQ4NKNUY3jIIlTL3Juz4uskRU2w.__data__:
{"id_":"V4iQtTH3f1U0dkQ4NKNUY3jIIlTL3Juz4uskRU2w1+0=","metadata":{},"excludedEmbedMetadataKeys":[],"excludedLlmMetadataKeys":[],"relationships":{},"hash":"YAVyfWMbeY0dTa1nNLJBnGtHOsEV/bNq7IU/b8Yt9Ow=","text":"
a partial solution. For example, if a company offered an electronic stethoscope with AI that helps 
diagnose atrial fibrillation, the clinician still needed other devices, tests and protocols to diagnose 
other conditions such as arrhythmias, congenital heart disease, coronary artery disease, 
cardiomyopathy etc. 
• Besides often generating a myriad of pairing issues, connecting a Bluetooth stethoscope during a 
telehealth session resulted in that device taking over the audio channel and the clinician being 
unable to talk with the patient. 
• Devices that might not function before or during an exam because the battery was drained. 
• Single purpose devices that often cost several hundred dollars were deemed not economically viable 
for a scalable solution and therefore did not warrant the time investment on the clinician’s side to 
evaluate and/or integrate. 
The resulting Venn diagram that became Medaica’s mantra, was for its solutions to be; Affordable, 
Simple and Interoperable. 
THE SOLUTION 
Among Medaica’s many different design decisions, was their choice of using a USB cable (with adaptors 
for any laptop, desktop or mobile device) rather than Bluetooth. That simplified the electronic design 
and user experience, reduced the cost, avoided potential interference issues and removed the need for 
batteries. As a USB device, the Medaica stethoscope is “plug and play” and in its simplest form can 
securely send audio files, together with an “auscultation map” to the clinician either in store and 
forward or live modes.  
The product design went through a number of iterations. It needed to be easy to hold but also easy to 
position in relation to the patient being able to position the device on an “auscultation map” in self-
exam mode. One of the early designs was essentially a stethoscope head but was rejected because the 
user’s hand would be covering the head and/or made a simple button push awkward (see Figs 1 & 2).  
 
            Fig 1. Awkward button placement (thumb)                                   Fig 2. OK button placement, but obscures head position 
The chosen design direction was to be more recognizably a stethoscope (See Fig.3). The head of the 
device is easy to see (or detect for assisted positioning approaches) when the user is placing the device 
in a specific auscultation position. The design is easy to manufacture and can be completely sealed and 
therefore also has the advantage that it is washable to IP6X standards. These decisions were made prior 
to COVID-19 flaring up but become even more compelling within that context. 
","textTemplate":"","metadataSeparator":"
","type":"DOCUMENT"}

zNP0hATIqCx/t6VZyHqbLYv2IZInAZY6/75iIrO3.__data__:
{"id_":"zNP0hATIqCx/t6VZyHqbLYv2IZInAZY6/75iIrO3F40=","metadata":{},"excludedEmbedMetadataKeys":[],"excludedLlmMetadataKeys":[],"relationships":{},"hash":"Thv3lYTP1kp7+FxgFbT/Uln+T03uBngdJbTwZKdr92A=","text":"
 
              Fig 3. Good button placement, good visibility of head position, comfortable to hold and separate body/voice mics. 
There were many technology decisions not only aimed at making the device easy to use, but easy to 
deploy and to potentially establish standard telehealth methods for patients and clinicians to quickly 
and easily share auscultation sounds. One of those decisions was to use two microphones configured for 
plug and play with any telehealth system, enabling both auscultation sounds and an independent 
channel for the user to speak, which also doubles for ambient/room noise reduction.  
Because Medaica’s solutions are designed to enhance existing telehealth solutions, not compete with 
them, they worked extremely hard to make sure that the clinician could continue to use whatever 
system they were already using, with the added benefit of adding auscultation to the exam. The pillars 
of that process were: 
• Balance clinician AND patient ease of use to get a more valuable and informed telehealth 
consultation for both sides.  
• Enable healthcare professionals to leverage existing workflows and systems. 
• Don’t compete with telehealth platforms – provide plug and play, agnostic, interoperability to any 
telehealth platform. Enable value-add to open their platforms to new specialties and stickier users. 
• KISS  (Keep It Simple Solutions) – solutions that work in the minimum number of steps with minimal 
behavioral change. 
• Affordable  – solutions that are priced for consumer scale. 
For more information about the Medaica Telehealth Stethoscope visit www.medaica.com. 
","textTemplate":"","metadataSeparator":"
","type":"DOCUMENT"}

{"id_":"f36ca0f8-2285-4ce9-9ff1-d3d7292c35e2","metadata":{},"excludedEmbedMetadataKeys":[],"excludedLlmMetadataKeys":[],"relationships":{"SOURCE":{"nodeId":"uOTwyoSYyHJV0N8yRVZtAG/ZL7MwpLQtaDDTpxFiG20=","metadata":{},"hash":"Iz0OQd6qgEUswnfnmOiJxQaCqovoCYqQdTDJDr0+6AY="},"NEXT":{"nodeId":"21026634-e7c8-4032-a5a7-12676780d3a6","metadata":{},"hash":"50UdtHNEqzBZR1DKZ1Z+VTFVz+RkZjmCYqzAHDM/Xpc="}},"hash":"pQSp8+25/862Mb6MPZI2RXW484tvHRZSOhTu0jKbF8w=","text":"© 2023 Medaica Inc. info@medaica.com |  www.medaica.com  
DATA SHEET 
 Medaica Telehealth+ 
 Simple, affordable, telehealth solution that combines a                                       
FREE FDA-cleared stethoscope for remote auscultation. - Improve the efficiency of supporting remote patients  
with clinical-grade exams and better outcomes
 
Medaica Telehealth+ is a simple and effective way for 
providers to extend their remote health capabilities. More than basic telehealth video conferencing, 
Medaica Telehealth+ is a digital-first connected care 
platform that combines audio/video features with a 
FREE FDA-cleared OTC stethoscope, specifically 
designed for plug-and-play remote auscultation, so 
healthcare providers can listen to a remote patient as 
easily and clearly as if they were in the same room. MEDAICA TELEHEALTH+ FEATURES 
Patient App 
• iOS 15+, iPadOS 15+, Android 12+. HCP App  
• Windows 10 and up, MacOS 10 and up on any 
browser supporting Web RTC including Chrome. • Patented remote auscultation guide for simple 
patient navigation, (HCP moves a virtual target for 
patient to place device). • Patented live-stream with background near real-time 
lossless upload (ensures clinical-grade audio is not  
• impacted by inconsistent internet connection). • Virtual, Store and Forward and In-Person Exams. • PCG visualization, loop and zoom. • Save and share recordings for benchmarking, 
longitudinal and cohort comparisons. • HCP interface includes stethoscope volume, filters, 
auscultation position, notes, patient messaging,   
waiting room, patient present alert, export to EMR. • Fully encrypted end-to-end, HIPAA compliant. M1 Telehealth Stethoscope. • FDA cleared 510(k), Class II, OTC, intended to be used  
by professional users in a clinical environment or by    
lay users 18+ (and approved for over 65 yrs old) in a 
nonclinical environment. • Specifically designed for remote auscultation over 
telehealth. • Patented two microphone design for auto-switching 
between auscultation and speaking for simple multi-
modal patient/ provider communications and 
auscultation recording. • Patented remote guidance for device placement.","textTemplate":"","metadataSeparator":"
","type":"TEXT"}

f37ae028-151d-40c7-8336-a1820ef2ae26.__data__:
{"id_":"f37ae028-151d-40c7-8336-a1820ef2ae26","metadata":{},"excludedEmbedMetadataKeys":[],"excludedLlmMetadataKeys":[],"relationships":{"SOURCE":{"nodeId":"I6NQZpxkCWWUzibxDsEJeLi1HfMYxkaNIgUGK7fNMFE=","metadata":{},"hash":"QqDGIrT6pHdVBvwE69UXnUB9asj5qQdjQh86mNHzgS4="},"NEXT":{"nodeId":"e39ea90b-2f7c-4d0c-a0ec-8044f5657255","metadata":{},"hash":"4Sre9I6xRXZ/szoZkJXM77f7NMFMZe24xH4VQDJQ8KY="}},"hash":"YdGNsi82k+BZk2bEmq9s54UTMwejbR806u9aVDfd7j0=","text":"March 2021
 
CONFIDENTIAL
 
1  
MEDAICA BUSINESS PLAN - EXECUTIVE SUMMARY 
INTRODUCTION 
MEDAICA is a digital health company dedicated to extending the capability of remote care across any telehealth system, 
simply and affordably. The Company’s Mission is “to enable digital health for everyone. ” 
MEDAICA’s Vision is “a world where everyone has access to healthcare, anywhere. ” 
The Company was founded by serial entrepreneurs with proven global experience in developing and scaling hardware and 
software  platforms,  managing  healthcare  businesses, and in bringing 
MedTech devices to market. MEDAICA’s first product the M1 Telehealth Stethoscope (“M1”) is a 
sub $50 plug-and-play  digital  stethoscope and  software  system 
specifically designed for interoperability  with any  telehealth 
application  to  enable  healthcare  professionals  to  remotely diagnose 
heart and body sounds. The patented M1 features ambient noise reduction, 
body and speaker independent microphones and can either be used by a patient in 
a live telehealth  session, or in “Store and Forward” mode, where a doctor can listen to the 
patient’s auscultation sounds in their own time, store them in the patient’s medical record and/or use them for 
baselining and future comparison. M1 improves quality of care, is convenient for the patient, increases revenue to the 
provider and reduces costs to the payer. OPPORTUNITY & TAM 
Although telemedicine is becoming increasingly popular (80% of people in USA have had a telehealth experience in the last 12 
months. Source McKinsey 2021), it is mostly limited to a few practice areas. J.P. Morgan estimates at least 35% of health visits 
will move to a “digital first” experience. Auscultation (listening to heart, lungs and other body sounds) is an integral part of a 
doctor’s clinical exam, yet there is no affordable or simple device that enables telehealth auscultation resulting in incomplete, 
or inefficient telehealth exams and reduced reimbursement fees.","textTemplate":"","metadataSeparator":"
","type":"TEXT"}

e39ea90b-2f7c-4d0c-a0ec-8044f5657255.__data__:
{"id_":"e39ea90b-2f7c-4d0c-a0ec-8044f5657255","metadata":{},"excludedEmbedMetadataKeys":[],"excludedLlmMetadataKeys":[],"relationships":{"SOURCE":{"nodeId":"I6NQZpxkCWWUzibxDsEJeLi1HfMYxkaNIgUGK7fNMFE=","metadata":{},"hash":"QqDGIrT6pHdVBvwE69UXnUB9asj5qQdjQh86mNHzgS4="},"PREVIOUS":{"nodeId":"f37ae028-151d-40c7-8336-a1820ef2ae26","metadata":{},"hash":"YdGNsi82k+BZk2bEmq9s54UTMwejbR806u9aVDfd7j0="}},"hash":"4Sre9I6xRXZ/szoZkJXM77f7NMFMZe24xH4VQDJQ8KY=","text":"Companies such as 3M, Eko Health and Tytocare, offer electronic stethoscopes priced from $138 - $500, however, other than 
TytoHome, ($249 + subscription), no devices have been cleared by the FDA for home use and none of the companies are 
“consumerising” the experience; instead, they provide complex products, not optimized for telehealth applications, and 
requiring expensive subscriptions to proprietary software to be used remotely. According to Deloitte Insights, The Future of 
Virtual Health, April 2020, by 2030, data, interoperability and consumer health technologies will be table stakes. MEDAICA addresses the market opportunity and shortcomings in existing devices by being focused on:  
• Affordable – Priced for consumer scale. • Accessible – By building interoperability into the platform from the start, MEDAICA does not compete with telemedicine 
platforms. We provide plug & play solutions to any telemedicine platform as well as adding value by extending their 
platforms to new specialties, generating incremental revenues and/or increasing subscribers and stickiness. • Simple  – Ease of use for patients with minimal behavioral change and little or no workflow changes for professionals.","textTemplate":"","metadataSeparator":"
","type":"TEXT"}

{"id_":"8493d438-0ac5-4391-a8b7-083348c07f96","metadata":{},"excludedEmbedMetadataKeys":[],"excludedLlmMetadataKeys":[],"relationships":{"SOURCE":{"nodeId":"YFRZNBFNPzTO8HunFjwsTmmLfWUhcRY4IRwph5xh3W0=","metadata":{},"hash":"74PHTWHAME0d3TE/fTIsDdUP96toY5uIthZQyeSOUa4="},"NEXT":{"nodeId":"ec02df29-4b5c-4575-958a-bd012bd22e60","metadata":{},"hash":"Fs+3uiW+/n12Bjep01JFOWxtDiLFJC8DWwy9cEQCuSg="}},"hash":"lirXppCQQBc5VncnF0we0cMgmh7bZK6UACKR+jJ+jFc=","text":"March 2021
 
CONFIDENTIAL
 
2  
The MEDAICA M1 Telehealth Stethoscope is a Trojan Horse to generate “Ground Truth” data that in turn will sustain the 
Company’s software business and ecosystem for 3
rd
 party services. Additionally, once the user-base and value of data is 
established, MEDAICA can white label and/or OEM its platform to other companies and establish a de-facto standard for 
enhanced remote care services. The Company will be able to sell premium services and leverage insights from its data that will 
become increasingly valuable for insurers/payers, healthcare practitioners and medical research. To that end, ultimately, data 
is MEDAICA’s most valuable IP asset (monetizable via additional diagnostic ML/AI services, API access, aggregated, geographic, 
historic data etc.), attracting annuity revenues via insights into the vital signs of millions of people and numerous touchpoints 
to upsell new products and/or services. Business models include but are not limited to, charging patients and/or telemedicine 
companies for  premium diagnostic  features,  surfacing  trends  (locally/nationally/globally),  working  with  payers  to ensure 
patients are adhering to their monitoring plans, and/or reducing re-admission rates. BUSINESS MODEL & FORECAST 
MEDAICA’s path to the consumer is a three-phase strategy:  
PHASE I: ADOPTION - M1 will initially be sold B2B2C, via telemedicine platform providers and large hospital groups, focusing 
on smaller and medium sized opportunities and strategic partners to build out end-to-end infrastructure and gain exposure in 
the marketplace. PHASE II: SCALE - With B2B2C market penetration, MEDAICA will start selling to retail (via distributors and direct web) and 
expanding overseas, first E.U. + U.K. PHASE III: DATA - With consumer scale comes the ability to standardize data and open the MEDAICA platform to 3
rd
 party 
developers  (such  as  AI  providers  and  other  hardware  companies). This  will  enable more vertical services such as ML/AI 
diagnostic applications that can further enhance the value to consumers and healthcare providers and establish MEDAICA’s 
data and platform as dominant solutions for heart and lung health.","textTemplate":"","metadataSeparator":"
","type":"TEXT"}

platforms  where  the  “pain”  to  provide  stickier

distributors and/or direct to consumers starting

194d7baf-bd50-4f70-865c-bc493ff5e1b4.__data__:
{"id_":"194d7baf-bd50-4f70-865c-bc493ff5e1b4","metadata":{},"excludedEmbedMetadataKeys":[],"excludedLlmMetadataKeys":[],"relationships":{"SOURCE":{"nodeId":"S8v/c1lTKfY/sdwUrhOKIPUTG05Rl402KABm4FWOjGY=","metadata":{},"hash":"eN6gO6Ae/yXjrY8xaVygmtvh3WJ8IghNeh+fPpCWN60="},"NEXT":{"nodeId":"880d6536-44bb-4210-9e0d-156a79c00fe8","metadata":{},"hash":"r/O1hNn/4W/4PyQ3Y0HKYaYEsFKKaAo4NiSDQ2s+zjk="}},"hash":"pnZWhnnqYPjMw8ep522ZaX4IOI0xhvChIRZ9DCKtgyI=","text":"Is this an overcrowded space? No! There are companies with expensive and proprietary diagnostic tools for 
doctors or companies with limited telehealth 1.0 solutions. NO COMPANY has a 
platform with inexpensive FDA-cleared OTC sensors and interoperable software 
for patients to access value-based chronic cardiac and pulmonary diagnostics. Could incumbants copy Medaica strategy? Competiting devices are ~$300+ vs Medaica‘s free sensors and are all proprietary, 
and don‘t work with telehealth systems without custom integration. Device 
companies (as opposed to software platforms), depend on high hardware margins. Telehealth platforms do not include sensors. Changing strategy would be a radical 
culture, org, tech and margin dispruption. Won‘t an army of cheaper sensor companies rush into the market? Sensors will continue to get cheaper (Moore‘s Law), but are unlikley to have FDA 
clearance for OTC, or be interoperable with virtual health A/V. Won’t Apple, Amazon or Google own this market? They are focused on broader healthcare strategies, which not interoperable (as 
can be seen via their respective approaches with medical records, research data, 
wearables and consumer apps). Amazon (via One Medical) is less device and 
service centric, so is a more interesting strategic player. If they are interested in 
what we’re doing, they’d be more likely to acquire us. Isn‘t virtual health growth slower in a post-COVID world? Yes –but higher than pre-Covid and growing. The perfect storm of over-burdened 
clincs, aging populations, expensive healthcare (in USA), and consumer comfort of 
“Digital First“ will lead to remote care that replaces a majority of unnecessary  in-
person health visits. Furthrmore, Teleheath 2.0 will replace the limited Telehealth   
1.0 and result in higher utility and growth. Who owns the data? Medaica owns the generic, aggregrated, non-identifiable data and has no desire to 
own personally identifiable information. Our licensees own PII. What other products/services are planned? Medaica‘s roadmap includes A.I., other sensors, and opening up the platform (OTIS) to 
3rd party devices, apps and services. What are Medaica‘s sustainable competitive advantages?","textTemplate":"","metadataSeparator":"
","type":"TEXT"}

880d6536-44bb-4210-9e0d-156a79c00fe8.__data__:
{"id_":"880d6536-44bb-4210-9e0d-156a79c00fe8","metadata":{},"excludedEmbedMetadataKeys":[],"excludedLlmMetadataKeys":[],"relationships":{"SOURCE":{"nodeId":"S8v/c1lTKfY/sdwUrhOKIPUTG05Rl402KABm4FWOjGY=","metadata":{},"hash":"eN6gO6Ae/yXjrY8xaVygmtvh3WJ8IghNeh+fPpCWN60="},"PREVIOUS":{"nodeId":"194d7baf-bd50-4f70-865c-bc493ff5e1b4","metadata":{},"hash":"pnZWhnnqYPjMw8ep522ZaX4IOI0xhvChIRZ9DCKtgyI="}},"hash":"r/O1hNn/4W/4PyQ3Y0HKYaYEsFKKaAo4NiSDQ2s+zjk=","text":"What are Medaica‘s sustainable competitive advantages? FDA clearance, Patents, Free/Scalable consumer device model (Razor/razorblade 
model), Data aggregation (first to get to 10s of millions of ausculation samples can 
dominate application and AI area), World class team. Who‘s your customer? Payors/ACOs, motivated to save on readmissions, or offer better outcomes. Ultimately, 
the consumer will pay for services either directly or via their insurance. What‘s a likely exit? Companies like Amazon or Wallmart looking at healthcare as a new consumer market. Google looking at the data play. Amwell or Teladoc looking to increase value/reach and 
stickiness of services. Medtronic, Omron, Boston Scientific, etc. Aren‘t doctors threatened by A.I. and/or virtual care? Market reserach confirms that most HCPs believe A.I. for assisted diganostics and 
virtial care are essential as part of the solution to improving outcomes and efficiences. How is the data going to be monetized? Exams are monetized. Additionally we will charge for longitudinal data, A.I. analyzed 
data, condition-based applications/services, research applications and ecosystem tariffs 
for 3rd Parties. Is Medaica a hardware or software business? Medaica is a software platform business. Specifcally, our platform is the enabling 
middleware glue, connecting endpoints between patients and providers. The M1 sensor 
is a Trojan Horse that, by giving away, seeds our scale. What keeps you up at night? Everything! Execution of new models in a traditional market is always challenging. But 
that‘s also the opportunity. Elephant(s) in the Room (The most asked questions)","textTemplate":"","metadataSeparator":"
","type":"TEXT"}

09b5b4f0-38b8-483a-aca3-8e31f4576a53.__data__:
{"id_":"09b5b4f0-38b8-483a-aca3-8e31f4576a53","metadata":{},"excludedEmbedMetadataKeys":[],"excludedLlmMetadataKeys":[],"relationships":{"SOURCE":{"nodeId":"LWWPGcKbp8rKh6ykdbiJ6kS7Wk6nUq2oGi3HGPkcEE4=","metadata":{},"hash":"smW88Bh/F0M0wRLDNj1MUDnMnCu5XjMKiBAS+lVY3hs="},"NEXT":{"nodeId":"b0b4007d-8129-42f1-9c61-4edab4df5a05","metadata":{},"hash":"R5ufD/9nnF3c8ApZkBMvNzwTZNPYOHm34ElBdXsNjcc="}},"hash":"fk8S70Zp5xwwdB/nuBBozLGVc7juqFThdfp8EgspYUI=","text":"April 2021 CONFIDENTIAL 1 
 
MEDAICA BUSINESS PLAN - EXECUTIVE SUMMARY 
INTRODUCTION 
MEDAICA is a digital health company dedicated to extending the capability of remote care across any telehealth system, 
simply and affordably. The Company’s Mission is “to enable digital health for everyone. ” 
MEDAICA’s Vision is “a world where everyone has access to healthcare, anywhere. ” 
The Company was founded by serial entrepreneurs with proven global experience in developing and scaling hardware and 
software   platforms,   managing   healthcare   businesses, and in bringing 
MedTech devices to market. MEDAICA’s first product the M1 Telehealth Stethoscope (“M1”) is a 
sub $50 plug-and-play  digital  stethoscope and  software  system 
specifically designed for interoperability   with any   telehealth 
application  to  enable  healthcare  professionals  to  remotely diagnose 
heart and body sounds. The patented M1 features ambient noise reduction, 
body and speaker independent microphones and can either be used by a patient in 
a live telehealth  session, or in “Store and Forward” mode, where a doctor  can  listen  to  the 
patient’s auscultation sounds in their own time, store them in the patient’s medical record and/or use them for 
baselining  and  future  comparison. M1 improves quality  of  care, is  convenient  for  the  patient,  increases  revenue  to  the 
provider and reduces costs to the payer. OPPORTUNITY & TAM 
Although telemedicine is becoming increasingly popular (80% of people in USA have had a telehealth experience in the last 12 
months, Source McKinsey 2021), it is mostly limited to a few practice areas. In 2019, pre-COVID-19, J.P. Morgan estimated at least 35% 
of health visits will move to a “digital first” experience. Auscultation (listening to heart, lungs and other body sounds) is an 
integral part of a doctor’s clinical exam, yet  there  is  no  affordable  or  simple  device  that  enables  telehealth  auscultation 
resulting in incomplete, or inefficient telehealth exams and reduced reimbursement fees.","textTemplate":"","metadataSeparator":"
","type":"TEXT"}

b0b4007d-8129-42f1-9c61-4edab4df5a05.__data__:
{"id_":"b0b4007d-8129-42f1-9c61-4edab4df5a05","metadata":{},"excludedEmbedMetadataKeys":[],"excludedLlmMetadataKeys":[],"relationships":{"SOURCE":{"nodeId":"LWWPGcKbp8rKh6ykdbiJ6kS7Wk6nUq2oGi3HGPkcEE4=","metadata":{},"hash":"smW88Bh/F0M0wRLDNj1MUDnMnCu5XjMKiBAS+lVY3hs="},"PREVIOUS":{"nodeId":"09b5b4f0-38b8-483a-aca3-8e31f4576a53","metadata":{},"hash":"fk8S70Zp5xwwdB/nuBBozLGVc7juqFThdfp8EgspYUI="}},"hash":"R5ufD/9nnF3c8ApZkBMvNzwTZNPYOHm34ElBdXsNjcc=","text":"Companies such as 3M, Eko Health and Tytocare, offer electronic stethoscopes priced from $138 - $500, however, other than 
TytoHome,  ($249 +  subscription),  no  devices  have  been  cleared  by  the  FDA  for  home  use  and  none  of  the  companies  are 
“consumerising” the  experience;  instead,  they  provide  complex  products,  not  optimized  for  telehealth  applications,  and 
requiring expensive subscriptions to proprietary software to be used remotely. According to Deloitte Insights, The Future of 
Virtual Health, April 2020, by 2030, data, interoperability and consumer health technologies will be table stakes. MEDAICA addresses the market opportunity and shortcomings in existing devices by being focused on:  
• Affordable – Priced for consumer scale. • Accessible – By building interoperability into the platform from the start, MEDAICA does not compete with telemedicine 
platforms. We provide plug & play solutions to any telemedicine platform as well as adding value by extending their 
platforms to new specialties, generating incremental revenues and/or increasing subscribers and stickiness. • Simple  – Ease of use for patients with minimal behavioral change and little or no workflow changes for professionals.","textTemplate":"","metadataSeparator":"
","type":"TEXT"}

1845fc21-eea9-48c9-b67b-63606caa21ba.__data__:
{"id_":"1845fc21-eea9-48c9-b67b-63606caa21ba","metadata":{},"excludedEmbedMetadataKeys":[],"excludedLlmMetadataKeys":[],"relationships":{"SOURCE":{"nodeId":"pOTOxZfwA7x2TYhxsCwGUfv+aMgOEmol49ZwNAmdM1s=","metadata":{},"hash":"nHHFbIN4bgK5Lvfn8t0Cn0W7zvIHRTFcrg3RR6lKJiI="},"NEXT":{"nodeId":"32775caf-75e3-458c-8426-bc2514aac47b","metadata":{},"hash":"aN0NV/Q9p6wEncbErM7lprHR1dvFLahOnu4+fHlg/DQ="}},"hash":"gEv8zHvM1bW19s/M1X7eYm1NX19CLyLKJN/8DaVkGVs=","text":"April 2021 CONFIDENTIAL 2 
 
The MEDAICA M1 Telehealth Stethoscope is a Trojan Horse to generate “Ground Truth” data that in turn will sustain the 
Company’s software business and ecosystem for 3rd party  services. Additionally,  once  the  user-base  and  value  of  data  is 
established, MEDAICA can  white  label  and/or  OEM  its  platform  to  other  companies  and  establish  a  de-facto  standard  for 
enhanced remote care services. The Company will be able to sell premium services and leverage insights from its data that will 
become increasingly valuable for insurers/payers, healthcare practitioners and medical research. To that end, ultimately, data 
is MEDAICA’s most valuable IP asset (monetizable via additional diagnostic ML/AI services, API access, aggregated, geographic, 
historic data etc.), attracting annuity revenues via insights into the vital signs of millions of people and numerous touchpoints 
to upsell new products and/or services. Business models include but are not limited to, charging patients and/or telemedicine 
companies  for  premium  diagnostic  features,  surfacing  trends  (locally/nationally/globally),  working  with  payers  to  ensure 
patients are adhering to their monitoring plans, and/or reducing re-admission rates. BUSINESS MODEL & FORECAST 
MEDAICA’s path to the consumer is a three-phase strategy:  
PHASE I: ADOPTION - M1 will initially be sold B2B2C, via telemedicine platform providers and large hospital groups, focusing 
on smaller and medium sized opportunities and strategic partners to build out end-to-end infrastructure and gain exposure in 
the marketplace. PHASE II: SCALE - With B2B2C market penetration, MEDAICA will start selling to retail (via distributors and direct web) and 
expanding overseas, first E.U. + U.K. PHASE III: DATA - With consumer scale comes the ability to standardize data and open the MEDAICA platform to  3rd party 
developers  (such  as  AI  providers  and  other  hardware  companies).","textTemplate":"","metadataSeparator":"
","type":"TEXT"}

32775caf-75e3-458c-8426-bc2514aac47b.__data__:
{"id_":"32775caf-75e3-458c-8426-bc2514aac47b","metadata":{},"excludedEmbedMetadataKeys":[],"excludedLlmMetadataKeys":[],"relationships":{"SOURCE":{"nodeId":"pOTOxZfwA7x2TYhxsCwGUfv+aMgOEmol49ZwNAmdM1s=","metadata":{},"hash":"nHHFbIN4bgK5Lvfn8t0Cn0W7zvIHRTFcrg3RR6lKJiI="},"PREVIOUS":{"nodeId":"1845fc21-eea9-48c9-b67b-63606caa21ba","metadata":{},"hash":"gEv8zHvM1bW19s/M1X7eYm1NX19CLyLKJN/8DaVkGVs="},"NEXT":{"nodeId":"2c3d06e2-05c2-442a-abc9-46711165cbd6","metadata":{},"hash":"YXV0hm5J0Aqhu8kVIMaGYDf3m3FbZjrinKnclE6SPVQ="}},"hash":"aN0NV/Q9p6wEncbErM7lprHR1dvFLahOnu4+fHlg/DQ=","text":"This  will  enable more  vertical  services  such  as ML/AI 
diagnostic applications that can further enhance the value to consumers and healthcare providers and establish MEDAICA’s 
data and platform as dominant solutions for heart and lung health. MEDAICA’s unit sales are forecast conservatively at 6,750 in the first 6 months as the business builds support, customer success 
processes and infrastructure. As the business scales, new unit U.S. sales are forecast to grow from 252,750 in 2022 to 1.13 
million in 2024, translating into a userbase approaching 2 million users by the end of 2024. This growth will be achieved by; 1) 
Focusing on medium and  large B2B customers, having proven the model with smaller customers in  the first  12 months; 2) 
Leveraging    the    growing    user    base    of 
telemedicine platforms where the “pain” to 
provide stickier services and greater utility is 
anticipated to create strategic opportunities; 
3) Selling to retail distributors and/or direct to 
consumers starting in 2023. The unit selling price to B2B partners ranges 
between   $49-$79   depending   on   volume 
commitments. The  business  is  also  likely  to 
generate   Non-Recurring   Engineering   (NRE) 
fees for specific customization or integration 
work   that   could   be   required   for   early 
installations. Such  revenue  is  NOT  a  long-
term   business   model,   but it is   useful   in 
subsidizing development and roadmap costs.","textTemplate":"","metadataSeparator":"
","type":"TEXT"}

During the second year of sales, as the userbase exceeds 250k users, the business model starts to generate annuity revenues 
and/or licensee fees (charged on a $1-$5 per-click or per seat fee, charged to telemedicine companies). The business becomes 
EBIT positive in 2023 and grows from EBIT of $4M that year (on revenue of $34M) to EBIT of $26M in 2024 (on revenue of 
$76M) as economies of scale, recurring sales and market validation benefits take effect. EveryBeatEveryBreath.org 
MEDAICA is working on a cause-driven campaign under the banner of EveryBeatEveryBreath.org, to provide devices at low or 
no cost to remote, underserved communities and disadvantaged groups. In the USA, nearly 53 million people (16%) live more 
than 30 miles from a hospital or urgent care. Globally, an estimated one billion people have no access to essential health-care 
services. The campaign aims to raise awareness of this issue and underpins MEDAICA’s mission. TEAM 
MEDAICA’s founding team has a rare mix of proven MedTech, healthcare, hardware, software and finance experience, both in 
global B2B and B2C businesses. STEPHEN RANDALL, CEO:  
A  serial  entrepreneur  with global   experience   building 
technology               platform businesses,    Stephen    was 
COO      of M3dicine,      a MedTech  device  company, 
CEO   of   LocaModa   Inc.,   a Digital      Out      of      Home 
platform                  company (acquired       by       Monster 
Media) a founder, COO and EVP of Symbian, the mobile 
OS  company  and  Joint  CEO of   Psion   Software   PLC.,   a  
mobile                   computing company. MARK GRETTON, CTO:  
Mark  has  over  thirty  years of  technology  management 
including                       senior  management/CTO  roles  at 
Psion      PLC      where      he developed  one  of  the  first 
ARM     based     application specific processor chips and 
TomTom    N.V.","textTemplate":"","metadataSeparator":"
","type":"TEXT"}

MICHAEL DRUES – Regulatory Advisor: President Vascular Sciences, Regulatory Consultant to FDA, Health Canada, HSA (Singapore). Adjunct Professor Cornell University (Dept. BioMedical 
Engineering) and George Washington University (School of Medicine and Health Sciences). IP 
The Company has 4 patent applications:  
1) Health hub using unique web-links to control access rights and enable additional services such as but not limited to 
diagnostic analysis, user verification, third party access rights, sharing/viewing rules and financial controls. 2) Telehealth audio methods including separate auscultation and user/room microphones. 3) High   level   healthcare   programming   environment enabling   device/exam   instructions,   reminders   and   message 
notifications to be  "chained"  together  to  help doctors  and  healthcare  organizations  produce  simple healthcare 
management protocols for remote patient care. 4) Telehealth self-exam methods including tagging sounds to body map positions, doctor remote controls and patient self-
exam augmented reality positioning. MEDAICA will continue putting significant resources on IP and patents as we believe innovation is core to our Mission. Full patent details available on request.","textTemplate":"","metadataSeparator":"

6e255fe8-3278-418d-ad85-413da5e0fcc3.__data__:
{"id_":"6e255fe8-3278-418d-ad85-413da5e0fcc3","metadata":{},"excludedEmbedMetadataKeys":[],"excludedLlmMetadataKeys":[],"relationships":{"SOURCE":{"nodeId":"TxyG/s5yKFcV41uE8ddJUG0wbU3V13c9hB/RqkqxaPY=","metadata":{},"hash":"D5ruYHuR4j5lZMX90tCqH6RsMza790AfulWzS9GQBQ0="},"NEXT":{"nodeId":"e4804aaf-731b-43eb-818f-7780c746b4b0","metadata":{},"hash":"BF3S36sXFmR8TwPnCOC+ZUkZYFQLHZy4b/tpBG/rB7k="}},"hash":"ZVUbNjB5WnShclWyVcMqg0LLt/ITRiF3dmQLcWar0TM=","text":"Medaica M1 Telehealth Stethoscope Software, Professional User Guide EN 
                                                    
© 2022 Medaica Inc. All Rights Reserved                Page 2 of 13 
 
INTRODUCTION 
Thank you for choosing Medaica Telehealth Software. Medaica Telehealth Software has been designed to enable healthcare 
providers to perform auscultation remotely; either by guiding patients who have a Medaica M1 Telehealth Stethoscope over a 
video call or by reviewing Store and Forward auscultation files recorded by patients or other healthcare professionals with a 
Medica M1 Telehealth Stethoscope. The Medaica M1 Telehealth Stethoscope delivers the latest in telehealth technology with ambient noise reduction, an 
auscultation microphone for body sounds, a voice microphone for speaking during telehealth video sessions and plug and play 
ease-of-use for Patient Store and Forward or clinician-guided live exams. Please use this manual if you are a) conducting telehealth exams and wish to auscultate remote patients who are using the 
Medaica M1 Telehealth Stethoscope or b) reviewing exams recorded on the Medaica M1 Telehealth Stethoscope and sent to 
you as Patient Store and Forward exams. For the purpose of this manual, the term Healthcare Providers includes but is not limited to clinicians, professional caregivers, 
nurses, nurse practitioners, physical and occupational therapists and home care aides and assumes at the very least, minimal 
experience to auscultate a patient and enter a patient’s information into a computer. NOTE: For healthcare providers wanting to use the Medaica M1 Telehealth Stethoscope M1 on patients directly (rather than 
remotely) to record store and forward exams, please refer to the Medaica Telehealth Stethoscope User Manual which is 
available at medaica.com. SAFETY INFORMATION 
Please read and follow all safety information in these instructions prior to using M1 Telehealth Stethoscope Software. Please 
refer to the Medaica M1 Telehealth Stethoscope for device safety information. Retain these instructions for future reference. CAUTIONS & WARNINGS 
• To reduce the risks associated with an incorrect result, operate this stethoscope software only as instructed in this manual. • Interpreting auscultation sounds requires professional training.","textTemplate":"","metadataSeparator":"
","type":"TEXT"}

6d17a698-b12e-45f1-aa89-4f9031b1e972.__data__:
{"id_":"6d17a698-b12e-45f1-aa89-4f9031b1e972","metadata":{},"excludedEmbedMetadataKeys":[],"excludedLlmMetadataKeys":[],"relationships":{"SOURCE":{"nodeId":"KS1/Ym5wcAYo5Q/Uyc05hyeAZegkjBZu7e7XFQeOPyM=","metadata":{},"hash":"Fiu6yv+yOSKU6lDsPmZxZRt/SX1w0yzoQNsUSlt3JeY="}},"hash":"sAtO1fxJMy1IJU1RPqqwK+qmfnnn+JdpnGX1aRTXvQs=","text":"Medaica M1 Telehealth Stethoscope Software, Professional User Guide EN 
                                                    
© 2022 Medaica Inc. All Rights Reserved                Page 3 of 13 
 
INTENDED USE 
The Medaica M1 Telehealth Stethoscope is an electronic stethoscope that enables transmission of auscultation sound data, 
whereby a clinician at one location on an IP network can listen to the auscultation sounds of a patient on site or at a different 
location on the IP network with the signal carried on an IP connection between the two locations. The Medica M1 Telehealth 
Stethoscope is intended to be used by professional users in a clinical environment or by lay users in a nonclinical environment. The device is for medical diagnostics purposes only. The device is not intended for self-diagnosis. CONTRAINDICATIONS 
None known.","textTemplate":"","metadataSeparator":"
","type":"TEXT"}

13aacfbf-b38e-4372-a3f3-18d44e06c2a0.__data__:
{"id_":"13aacfbf-b38e-4372-a3f3-18d44e06c2a0","metadata":{},"excludedEmbedMetadataKeys":[],"excludedLlmMetadataKeys":[],"relationships":{"SOURCE":{"nodeId":"iSkd89ENJHrK2/rOxnZZybsZkOIQkdhOmFSQ/IMG3BU=","metadata":{},"hash":"//x41uN+6bx5w4v9zIkZXhFTQu0Zih4r0l7ml7tGnC4="}},"hash":"NENy4cFjLAweECzyQ0QQfnNKbCxzS1uZLqhd66A9vZY=","text":"Medaica M1 Telehealth Stethoscope Software, Professional User Guide EN 
                                                    
© 2022 Medaica Inc. All Rights Reserved                Page 4 of 13 
 
INSTRUCTIONS FOR USE 
 
 
HOW THE MEDAICA SYSTEM WORKS 
The M1 stethoscope connects to the patient’s computer (Apple or Windows) or mobile device (iPhone, iPad or Android) to 
communicate with their healthcare provider via an internet connection. Instructions for using the M1 stethoscope are available at mediaca.com. The Medica software that works with the M1 stethoscope enables two types of remote exams;  
Live Exams are conducted with a healthcare provider remotely guiding the patient via a telehealth session, listening to their 
heart and/or lung sounds and recording that data, subject to the patient’s permission. Store and Forward (Self) Exams are done in the patient’s own time, recording heart and/or lung sounds and then sending those 
results to their healthcare provider. Live Exams and Store and Forward Exams use the same approach and are described in detail in the following pages.","textTemplate":"","metadataSeparator":"
","type":"TEXT"}

{"id_":"fb53339a-872d-4b71-b184-59cf4d6e4cc1","metadata":{},"excludedEmbedMetadataKeys":[],"excludedLlmMetadataKeys":[],"relationships":{"SOURCE":{"nodeId":"/cHrY4yC8VrRYyx2sV7xNE4V3fGYq9n9wQsO58JI/L0=","metadata":{},"hash":"0usmdJ5ogwTbqtqTuUw5FfqVkiaYgDdUIH2NR0r9yRs="}},"hash":"Ca9AcdMyV0RfaAmeOfXrqCvUJBjc8YDdzwY1fUwGsHE=","text":"Medaica M1 Telehealth Stethoscope Software, Professional User Guide EN 
                                                    
© 2022 Medaica Inc. All Rights Reserved                Page 5 of 13 
 
1. Before using Medaica Telehealth Software for the first time 
Prior to using the Medaica Telehealth Software for the first time, ensure that you have a computer that meets the minimum 
system requirements. Visit: www.medaica.com/help for more information on system requirements. 2. Sign Up/Log In/Dashboard 
Create a Healthcare Provider account and/or Log In at medaica.com. Once you Log In, you can access your Account Settings, Patient records and 
Exams. Account Settings is where you can change your password and email 
settings. Patients is where you add/edit patient information in the system and  
Exams is where you control exam settings. 3. Create a New Patient Entry 
Select Patients  
Select New Patient  
Add the patient details 
Select Save Changes 
Select Save. 4. Patient Store and Forward Exam  
A Store and Forward Exam is an exam a Patient can 
conduct in their own time for the specific 
auscultation positions you require. Confirm patient has read and understood 
the  instructions before asking them to 
perform a Store and Forward exam. Store 
and Forward exam. Confirm patient has successfully used the 
M1 Stethoscope in a Live Exam before 
asking them to use it in a Store and Forward 
Exam. To create a Store and Forward exam: 
Select Patients in the sidebar 
Select Create Store and Forward Exam 
Select Patient Details to see an existing list of Patients or add them as a new patient. Select Save Changes","textTemplate":"","metadataSeparator":"
","type":"TEXT"}

The Store and Forward Exam template is 
displayed. Enter an Exam date for the Patient. Enter any additional notes for your patient such 
as asking them to contact your office if they 
require additional assistance. Click on the Heart and/or Lung auscultation 
positions you wish the patient to record. Select Save 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
This is what the patient sees... The patient will receive an automated message from you with the exam date and a link to the exam and auscultation 
positions you selected. When the patient clicks on Go to Self Exam they 
enter a secure page with the step-by-step exam 
procedure based on the auscultation positions you 
selected for them.","textTemplate":"","metadataSeparator":"

a40fd4e6-463b-4431-a404-e4e032251f64.__data__:
{"id_":"a40fd4e6-463b-4431-a404-e4e032251f64","metadata":{},"excludedEmbedMetadataKeys":[],"excludedLlmMetadataKeys":[],"relationships":{"SOURCE":{"nodeId":"q9cqw/SnlHIHFbD2hXVcVWv3fUbwbGR8xqG9YqRkg4g=","metadata":{},"hash":"6tA39+w1Ic3Frm8jjPBKSOYaZkfjl4utfdgfQU1o6OI="}},"hash":"IQtIO7ZvaS/gF7tLzzlgyJTVRxcdKtfGV60anlpBrTo=","text":"Medaica M1 Telehealth Stethoscope Software, Professional User Guide EN 
                                                    
© 2022 Medaica Inc. All Rights Reserved                Page 7 of 13 
 
 
The Patient’s software displays an instruction 
page and checks that their Medaica M1 
Telehealth Stethoscope is connected. If the M1 
is not connected, the system displays an error 
message and will not progress until it detects 
the stethoscope. Once the software confirms the Patient’s 
stethoscope is connected, the Patient sees the 
first auscultation recording position displayed. The patient is guided through each auscultation 
position via an on-screen body map. When the patient completes their Store 
and Forward Exam, the system notifies 
you that their recordings are ready to be 
reviewed.","textTemplate":"","metadataSeparator":"

36c2d8d6-ccaa-4af9-945d-91004dd9cffe.__data__:
{"id_":"36c2d8d6-ccaa-4af9-945d-91004dd9cffe","metadata":{},"excludedEmbedMetadataKeys":[],"excludedLlmMetadataKeys":[],"relationships":{"SOURCE":{"nodeId":"2bTXyc/4MiRItelODsv1QQ2amgrpri/f8rrxCaP/MDM=","metadata":{},"hash":"a8vkAng0TZ3kBGeGVbIcFVTPI2Fc6+Jg2BjrrrWSex8="}},"hash":"0KAZ1vWe6NdxaSmrG8F14rpKPnRVWF9VXIpayG7xPNg=","text":"Medaica M1 Telehealth Stethoscope Software, Professional User Guide EN 
                                                    
© 2022 Medaica Inc. All Rights Reserved                Page 8 of 13 
 
You will see the patient’s exam status updated 
on your dashboard, marked as an Unreviewed 
Exam  
 
 
 
Click on View to review each auscultation file. Press the play icon         to review the audio of a 
specific auscultation position. When the auscultation file is playing, the 
Phonocardiogram (PCG) can be expanded to 
view in finer detail. Bell, Diaphragm and Extended filters can be 
switched on to help you focus on specific 
frequencies. Sounds can also be boosted by sliding the 
volume slider. A notes field enables any notes to be added for 
the exam. Request a live exam or an alternative exam if you are not satisfied that the patient has followed your instructions 
completely or if any recordings sound too noisy or too quiet to diagnose.","textTemplate":"","metadataSeparator":"
","type":"TEXT"}

69511791-4648-4e4d-af6d-4cb86f24bb60.__data__:
{"id_":"69511791-4648-4e4d-af6d-4cb86f24bb60","metadata":{},"excludedEmbedMetadataKeys":[],"excludedLlmMetadataKeys":[],"relationships":{"SOURCE":{"nodeId":"Yq9FQlXScHUTp2s57Z6oUduKTgwanimPC08vkRempoE=","metadata":{},"hash":"fbY+hj0qgJ7e+PRJy6LO8ZxsQQPkSabFl/IwHzEPhZw="}},"hash":"VX90O/Y05fUoZQ2NxuODsuCi4mpl5MWhFh3LX/dz1+4=","text":"Medaica M1 Telehealth Stethoscope Software, Professional User Guide EN 
                                                    
© 2022 Medaica Inc. All Rights Reserved                Page 9 of 13 
 
 
5. Live Exam  
To conduct a Live Exam 
 
Either add Patient Details from the existing list 
of patients or add them as a new patient and 
select Save Changes. Select Start Live Exam from the Patients tab. The Live Exam join details for the patient are 
displayed. Select Send Join Info to send an email to the 
patient with a link to medaica.com and a secure 
code to enter the Exam. NOTE: If the Patient is already online, you can 
ask them to manually navigate to medaica.com, 
select Live Exam and type in their unique Code. This is what the patient sees... When the patient clicks the link you sent, they will see a window 
requesting they enter Live Exam access code. They enter the 
access code and press Submit to continue to the Live Exam page. If the Patient is already online, you can ask them to manually 
navigate to medaica.com, select Live Exam and type in their 
unique Code. If you wish to use a separate web-based telehealth video system with your patient, you will need to open a new 
tab in your browser for the Medaica exam.","textTemplate":"","metadataSeparator":"
","type":"TEXT"}

dbf47380-d94b-4ddc-a555-226eca369eaa.__data__:
{"id_":"dbf47380-d94b-4ddc-a555-226eca369eaa","metadata":{},"excludedEmbedMetadataKeys":[],"excludedLlmMetadataKeys":[],"relationships":{"SOURCE":{"nodeId":"O0a/fsLZtwGQWLNX2h1SLTzdbholotkMKx6oY6TDl3o=","metadata":{},"hash":"6wUE0dTvH1bmBHQ+pC1WlctYrHNGmCvcdj/CLwKT2Mk="}},"hash":"6GsAMLnVeaV8CAS3CYr0sbtZL+sPm3NsDtc/aNvwDcg=","text":"Medaica M1 Telehealth Stethoscope Software, Professional User Guide EN 
                                                    
© 2022 Medaica Inc. All Rights Reserved                Page 10 of 13 
 
You will now be able to see and hear the patient and can guide on the correct placement of the stethoscope as you record their 
auscultation sounds. As you face your screen, you are looking at a mirrored image of yourself and a facing image of your patient (i.e. as if 
the patient is facing you). Your patient will see your image unmirrored, as if you are facing them. You can turn off 
Mirroring in settings. If the patient has not plugged in their M1 Stethoscope, or it is not recognized by their system (see Troubleshooting), 
you and the patient will see an on-screen prompt “please plug in your M1 Stethoscope”  
 
You have control over the stethoscope’s listen/record function. Press Listen to hear the patient’s auscultation sounds and start 
recording 
 
 
 
 
  
 Recording Quality: In order to achieve a high quality and clear recording of heart and/or lung sounds, 
remind the patient: 
• To make sure they are in a quiet location 
• not to move the stethoscope during recording and  
• not to speak during the recording. For listening back to the recorded body sounds, connect high quality over-the-ear headphones to your 
computer or mobile device. Open style headphones, ear buds, computer or mobile device loudspeakers 
are not suitable for listening to low frequency auscultation sounds.","textTemplate":"","metadataSeparator":"
","type":"TEXT"}

8bdc1eb7-b70c-466e-9a69-ba86b172f61d.__data__:
{"id_":"8bdc1eb7-b70c-466e-9a69-ba86b172f61d","metadata":{},"excludedEmbedMetadataKeys":[],"excludedLlmMetadataKeys":[],"relationships":{"SOURCE":{"nodeId":"cDBxmJZ3hNKGjoatehOT9fxZWq5seO5msC5IK4FPlQ4=","metadata":{},"hash":"k6KsAvnSpgFOcZdIWyEfAcFthw/0K1Oawjr/W6/VC/k="}},"hash":"8p/9tyD4CF8OlUHAnA618vqMVFX4dPreMVASqlvWl/U=","text":"Medaica M1 Telehealth Stethoscope Software, Professional User Guide EN 
                                                    
© 2022 Medaica Inc. All Rights Reserved                Page 11 of 13 
 
6. Frequently Asked Questions and Troubleshooting 
Can the patient use the M1 Stethoscope with any telehealth system? Telehealth systems that run in a web browser work with M1 on an Apple Mac, Windows PC or Android mobile device. Many 
telehealth systems that also work on mobile apps will also work with M1, but some iOS telehealth apps might not be 
compatible. Can the patient use the Mi Stethoscope with any laptop or mobile device? Yes, as long as your laptop or mobile device meets the Minimum System Requirements. Why can’t I login to the Medaica App? Try checking your user login details (username/password). Make sure you have internet connection on your computer of 
mobile device. Make sure that your Internet connection is working properly and that your computer or mobile device is connected to it. Make sure that you have the right name and password for your Internet access 
Make sure you have the right name and password for your medaica.com account. If the above does not resolve your problem, please contact Medaica Support. I’ve forgotten my password; how do I access my account? Click Login, then Click on “Forgot Password. ”  
If the above does not resolve your problem, please contact Medaica Support. How do I get the patient to record a good signal for their exam? Ask the patient to take the exam in a quiet location. They need to eliminate as much external noise as possible during the exam. They must not move the device on the body during recording. They must make sure the device is in full contact with and placed firmly on their body or over a light shirt. They must use the device on their skin or over a thin shirt or tee shirt. They must not use the device over thick clothing. If the above does not resolve their problem, please contact Medaica Support. For more support information, visit: www.medaica.com/support and/or email support@medaica.com","textTemplate":"","metadataSeparator":"
","type":"TEXT"}

Patient Privacy 
The privacy of patient health information may be protected by state, federal, or international/foreign laws that 
regulate how such information can be used, stored, transmitted and disclosed. The Medaica  system employs 
security features that are compliant with HIPAA policies. Third party access may be prohibited to such information 
without obtaining written authorization from the patient. The user is fully responsible for understanding and 
following all laws that regulate storage, transmission, and disclosure of any electronic patient data through the use 
of software. If the user becomes unable to comply with a law or restriction that applies to use and disclosure of 
such data, the user should not proceed to collect or save such information. This application may require entry of 
individually identifiable health information in order to function. Records are stored and recalled through the use of 
patient name, date of birth, and/or patient ID #. By entering this information, the user assumes any and all risks of 
and liabilities  incurred  with  using  or  transmitting  such information","textTemplate":"","metadataSeparator":"
","type":"TEXT"}

1feeef76-2792-4873-ba8e-e4a22a47d1e2.__data__:
{"id_":"1feeef76-2792-4873-ba8e-e4a22a47d1e2","metadata":{},"excludedEmbedMetadataKeys":[],"excludedLlmMetadataKeys":[],"relationships":{"SOURCE":{"nodeId":"vOUpqxVS8NwPuE0MgFBxICJWODgXuOoCfgI46xgSlcQ=","metadata":{},"hash":"YVKRB6zW1q5VDWqiYJjGAxbuw/NqdZ/KnQGl5HmJX4g="},"NEXT":{"nodeId":"d13fa4a7-8d74-4394-beaa-4b67a15e2a49","metadata":{},"hash":"+EcwUlSPhP2TaVbjBCG0xLO5BGf36aFOGGmp9Dy399I="}},"hash":"1NLtORWO/Bb1DFtzEOflUSTVE4QzcMJJeBL7MPVb1V8=","text":"Medaica receives FDA clearance for M1 Telehealth Stethoscope 
Consumer stethoscope makes “digital house calls” possible over telehealth 
 
HENDERSON, NV, USA, Jan. 20, 2023 - Medaica, a digital health company, extending the 
capability of home diagnostics, today announced its Medaica M1 Telehealth Stethoscope has 
received U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) 510(k) clearance. 1
 
The Medaica M1 Telehealth Stethoscope (M1) has been cleared for Over-the-Counter (OTC) use 
by consumers. M1 is a plug-and-play solution for a patient to connect to a doctor, who can then 
listen to a remote patients’ hearts, lungs, or other organ sounds over a telehealth visit, as easily 
and clearly as if they were in the same room. “A medical exam that would otherwise require either an expensive proprietary system or an in-
person appointment, can now be a simple and standard feature of any telehealth visit,” said 
Stephen Randall, CEO of Medaica. “We can make a doctor’s ‘digital house call’ something that 
anyone, anywhere has access to. ” 
Interoperability with 3
rd
 party telehealth systems is built into the Medaica solution and is 
becoming a requirement that many healthcare organizations including the American Telehealth 
Association 
2
 recognize as fundamental to realizing the full potential of digital health. The Medaica M1 Telehealth Stethoscope is bundled with a complete end-to-end digital 
diagnostics and telehealth solution for providers who want the full capability of using M1 for 
remote auscultation with best-in-class telehealth features, in one integrated solution. Medaica has been working with several leading hospitals and clinics to support their healthcare 
initiatives including Emory Hospital, Georgia. Dr Byron Williams Jr., Emeritus Chief of Medicine at Emory University Hospital commented, 
“Providing affordable and accessible healthcare solutions to our rural patients is one of our 
biggest challenges. Medaica’s M1 Telehealth stethoscope enhances our remote care, making it 
possible for us to conduct post-acute follow-up telehealth exams, resulting in greater efficiencies 
and more affordable healthcare.","textTemplate":"","metadataSeparator":"
","type":"TEXT"}

3aabac06-4450-4eb6-83ec-1f15e986514c.__data__:
{"id_":"3aabac06-4450-4eb6-83ec-1f15e986514c","metadata":{},"excludedEmbedMetadataKeys":[],"excludedLlmMetadataKeys":[],"relationships":{"SOURCE":{"nodeId":"ksAmreMRIf+OvvYJmxyVqTF2qT+Ov4LFJomW13Cj7ZU=","metadata":{},"hash":"CO5yMZzxcz0NrttW71s15yUi4D6mFwL3puxh01aZn1c="},"NEXT":{"nodeId":"5106f2f4-346f-4a22-8855-a844beec2597","metadata":{},"hash":"ptCwi7R6m7B/3MVyO3xsZimAsSfWaMxo489BrAypEk4="}},"hash":"MHtKTPHLGdbMAHFOaBLDCjyZLnbAKDtCHSsOTuYllT4=","text":"Medaica Announces Free FDA-Cleared M1 Telehealth 
Stethoscope for Rural and Underserved Patients 
First free FDA-cleared digital stethoscope for consumers 
 
HENDERSON, NV, USA, April 13, 2023 /PRNewswire/ - Medaica, a digital health company 
extending the capability of home diagnostics, today announced that the Medaica M1 Telehealth 
Stethoscope (M1) will be free of charge, starting with qualifying strategic partners supporting 
rural or underserved patients with chronic heart and/or lung conditions. Medaica is the first company to provide a free U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) cleared 
1
 
digital stethoscope for in-home use. The M1 stethoscope has been designed with a focus on 
being patient-centric, affordable, and interoperable. Most existing digital stethoscopes are 
designed for clinicians, not patients, and are proprietary, so do not work with existing telehealth 
systems. “By making the Medica M1 Telehealth Stethoscope free for rural and underserved patients, we 
aim to accelerate awareness of and access to more a compelling remote healthcare option for 
those who need it the most,” said Stephen Randall, CEO of Medaica. “We believe that 
telehealth’s ultimate potential will be realized when millions of patients can be examined as 
effectively on-line as they can in clinic. Consumerizing the stethoscope is the first step in making 
that a reality, while reducing the burden of understaffed clinics. ” 
• Nearly 80% of rural America is medically underserved. With fewer than 40 physicians per 
100,000 people, a problem that is getting worse every year as the population gets older and 
more healthcare workers leave the profession. 2
  
• Physician demand continues to outstrip supply, leading to a projected shortage of between 
37,800 and 124,000 physicians by 2034 with the most alarming gaps in primary care and rural 
communities, according to the Association of American Medical Colleges. 3  
 
Dr.","textTemplate":"","metadataSeparator":"
","type":"TEXT"}

5106f2f4-346f-4a22-8855-a844beec2597.__data__:
{"id_":"5106f2f4-346f-4a22-8855-a844beec2597","metadata":{},"excludedEmbedMetadataKeys":[],"excludedLlmMetadataKeys":[],"relationships":{"SOURCE":{"nodeId":"ksAmreMRIf+OvvYJmxyVqTF2qT+Ov4LFJomW13Cj7ZU=","metadata":{},"hash":"CO5yMZzxcz0NrttW71s15yUi4D6mFwL3puxh01aZn1c="},"PREVIOUS":{"nodeId":"3aabac06-4450-4eb6-83ec-1f15e986514c","metadata":{},"hash":"MHtKTPHLGdbMAHFOaBLDCjyZLnbAKDtCHSsOTuYllT4="}},"hash":"ptCwi7R6m7B/3MVyO3xsZimAsSfWaMxo489BrAypEk4=","text":"3  
 
Dr. Jennifer Peña, former White House physician under both the Obama and Trump 
administrations and member of the American Telemedicine Association's Advisory Group to 
Eliminate Healthcare Disparities and Inequalities, who recently joined Medaica as its Chief 
Medical Officer commented, “Prior to the Medaica M1 Telehealth Stethoscope, the ability to 
auscultate a patient using telehealth was expensive and complicated. Giving patients a simple 
and free FDA-cleared stethoscope for remote telehealth exams is a game changer, especially for 
the many who can’t so easily travel to the clinic. ” 
The Medaica M1 Telehealth Stethoscope is bundled with Medaica Telehealth+, a complete 
digital diagnostics and telehealth solution for providers in one solution. For interoperability with 
existing telehealth systems, M1 can be used without requiring any specific customization or 
integration.","textTemplate":"","metadataSeparator":"
","type":"TEXT"}

c1332d31-2091-44d5-a828-ac43f2da8f02.__data__:
{"id_":"c1332d31-2091-44d5-a828-ac43f2da8f02","metadata":{},"excludedEmbedMetadataKeys":[],"excludedLlmMetadataKeys":[],"relationships":{"SOURCE":{"nodeId":"GGaDiZ+MgtG6s+fsveXIyyci1uanT2Zj1Irq+zxdffQ=","metadata":{},"hash":"lH5OjBm+azGSPxqfk9UqcS3gCsMZvFt6yExDxWXt+Ao="},"NEXT":{"nodeId":"1a5d5649-0aaf-426f-b79b-e0d0e1d1a71b","metadata":{},"hash":"839fZDQQ1BsEOJEtvipA3TVCeVoexGGlRdAUmhzNvlA="}},"hash":"IwFAgMdk1QmN4ufz9/9ohUWeRyQ10zWeCzz4p8R4NKM=","text":"Medaica Launches Telehealth+ Remote Diagnostics Platform  
Designed to unburden clinics, Telehealth+ offers affordable remote auscultation and diagnostics 
modules 
 
HENDERSON, NV, USA, Mar 28, 2023 -  Medaica, a digital health company, extending the 
capability of home diagnostics, today launched Telehealth+, a remote auscultation and 
diagnostics platform, designed to unburden clinics via affordable and simple clinical-grade 
remote exams. Telehealth+ comes bundled with Medaica’s M1 Telehealth Stethoscope,
 
an FDA-cleared 
1 stethoscope for Over-the-Counter (OTC) use by consumers and is available as a complete 
telehealth system or in modules that are interoperable with existing telehealth systems. “With Telehealth+ and the FDA-cleared Medaica M1 Telehealth Stethoscope, providers can now 
extend auscultation to anyone with an internet connected device,” said Stephen Randall, CEO of 
Medaica. “We envision a new generation of telehealth applications that provide much more than 
simple video calls. For millions of patients and their providers, clinical-grade exams via what we 
could call ‘Telehealth 2.0,’ has the power to democratize access to healthcare and help 
unburden clinics. ” 
For more details on how the Medaica M1 Telehealth Stethoscope and Medaica Telehealth+ can 
enhance telehealth offerings, please contact 1-888-MEDAICA (1-888-633-2422),  
info@medaica.com or visit www.medaica.com. 1. https://www.accessdata.fda.gov/cdrh_docs/pdf22/K223166.pdf 
About Medaica  
Medaica is a digital health company, extending the reach and capability of home diagnostics. The 
company’s mission is to enable affordable access to quality healthcare for everyone. Medaica’s 
products include the FDA-cleared Medaica M1 Telehealth Stethoscope and Medaica Telehealth+, 
a digital diagnostics and telehealth platform. Medaica is headquartered in Henderson, Nevada, 
with offices in London and Madrid. For more information visit: www medaica.com 
Medaica, Medaica Telehealth+ and Medaica M1 Telehealth Stethoscope are trademarks of Medaica Inc.","textTemplate":"","metadataSeparator":"
","type":"TEXT"}

f5a34c54-fcc2-4193-bd43-ee32c3437d1d.__data__:
{"id_":"f5a34c54-fcc2-4193-bd43-ee32c3437d1d","metadata":{},"excludedEmbedMetadataKeys":[],"excludedLlmMetadataKeys":[],"relationships":{"SOURCE":{"nodeId":"c9Dlu/ts0ygkyNArkZasx9SsJei8ge77CuB6ywAKH3c=","metadata":{},"hash":"gmwZkZRJx4Eo6FrRBqAsodhpctIjA1+aV+syWGq5dOA="}},"hash":"0N3kATIICfVWs7o2lsGBI4JzR9sQG0gwwshVhiWzgEY=","text":"About eMurmur 
eMurmur is a technology partner to the global healthcare community specializing in advanced 
digital auscultation. Supporting heart, lung, and bowel health screenings, the company seeks to 
elevate the practice of auscultation in every interaction. eMurmur partners with leading 
hardware and telehealth providers to integrate high-definition auscultation technology into 
healthcare practice, whether delivering in-home, in-clinic, or virtual care. Using advanced 
engineering, eMurmur makes it possible for healthcare providers performing auscultation to 
screen, monitor, diagnose, and consult with greater certainty. For more information, visit: https://emurmur.com/ 
Media Contact: 
Andreas Schriefl  
andreas.schriefl@emurmur.com","textTemplate":"","metadataSeparator":"
","type":"TEXT"}

46722c22-86bd-4b8c-b792-09d517d9736a.__data__:
{"id_":"46722c22-86bd-4b8c-b792-09d517d9736a","metadata":{},"excludedEmbedMetadataKeys":[],"excludedLlmMetadataKeys":[],"relationships":{"SOURCE":{"nodeId":"./datasources/medaica/Medaica website.html","metadata":{},"hash":"IpYTHJP0214uZp+lLM+gBbVALzrA7VQSGzS0kfHk0+I="},"NEXT":{"nodeId":"b0783b57-5066-4e32-9fed-85041db239f3","metadata":{},"hash":"J97mA+RI3Bk5zzV+TZp7G+uDB1XGtSMsW7/QVmvQqpU="}},"hash":"ihccHlSHhfmIQPuWDBzZPXWFtKPVNZrMhYbzuiqU9Co=","text":"Medaica | Virtual Health

top of page

Contact Us About us Insights Products Providers Patients Jobs News Blog More Use tab to navigate through the menu items. MEDAICA is a digital health company extending the reach and capability of remote care We believe everyone should have simple and affordable access to healthcare. See how we're making that happen. Medaica Telehealth+ Diagnostic Platform Insights Medaica’s platform and products are designed for interoperability to help future-proof our partners' operations. Affordable FDA cleared M1 Telehealth Stethoscope designed for consumer scale and FREE for strategic partners supporting rural, or underserved patients and chronic heart and/or lung conditions. Simple Ease of use for patients, minimal workflow changes for healthcare professionals. Accessible Plug & play, interoperable with any telemedicine platform. insights Insights There is a huge gap between willingness to use Telehealth and actual use in most medical specialties due to lack of easy to use, affordable and compatible platforms and relevant devices. Sci-Fi's vision of the future included systems that could diagnose patients instantly. Reality is getting there but the devil is in the details. ​

Several digital devices and platforms today can diagnose a few conditions, but most are proprietary, expensive, difficult to use and rarely regulated for home use by consumers. ​

In our opinion (and the opinion of thought-leaders at the American Telehealth Association, American Medical Association, Centers for Disease Control and Prevention and Healthcare Information and Management Systems Society) we need platforms that support:

​

Interoperability of software and hardware to enable healthcare providers and patients to use any solutions that work with their existing systems. Patient-centric design to deliver ease of use at an affordable price with regulatory clearance for “Over the Counter” home use and

An open ecosystem to support ever-changing and emerging 3rd Party AI, tools and devices. 358M Households USA, EU & UK ​

358M Households in the USA and Western Europe. EU 195M
USA 133 M
UK 30M

​ ​

​

World Bank 2020 ~$250B ​

​

McKinsey 2021 ​

~20% of Medicare, Medicaid, Outpatient, Office and Home Health spend could be virtualized.","textTemplate":"","metadataSeparator":"
","type":"TEXT"}
